translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and springs,

arabic_text: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ
translation: receiving what their Lord will give them, for they were indeed doers of good beforehand.

arabic_text: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
translation: They used to sleep only a little at night[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., spending most of the night in prayer, reciting the Qur’an, and in supplication.

arabic_text: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
translation: and before dawn they would seek forgiveness[5],
footnotes: [5] Supererogatory prayers and supplications are recommended before dawn.

arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
translation: and in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the destitute.

arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ
translation: On earth there are signs for those who are certain in faith,

arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
translation: and also within yourselves. Do you not see?

arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
translation: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are promised.

arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ
translation: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, this [resurrection] is certainly as true as the fact that you can speak.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
translation: Has there come to you the story of Abraham’s honored guests[6]?
footnotes: [6] Honorable angels with Allah.

arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
translation: When they came to him and said, “Peace.” He said, “Upon you be peace.” [saying to himself] “Unknown people!”

arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ
translation: Then he went quickly to his household, and came with a fat [roasted] calf,

arabic_text: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
translation: and placed it before them and said, “Will you not eat?”

arabic_text: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
translation: He felt apprehensive about them[7]. They said, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him glad tidings of a knowledgeable son.
footnotes: [7] In their culture, if a guest refused to eat the food provided, it was considered a sign of ill will. See footnote 11:70.

arabic_text: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
translation: His wife cried out loud, and struck her face [in astonishment] and said, “[I am] a barren old woman!”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
translation: They said, “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.”

arabic_text: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
translation: Abraham said, “Then what is your mission, O messengers?”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
translation: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people,

arabic_text: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ
translation: to send down upon them stones of clay,

arabic_text: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
translation: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”

arabic_text: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: We brought out those believers who were there,

arabic_text: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
translation: but We only found in it one Muslim household[8].
footnotes: [8] Lot's family except his wife.

arabic_text: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
translation: And We left there a sign[9] for those who fear the painful punishment.
footnotes: [9] i.e., the ruins of Sodom or the Dead Sea in Palestine, as a lesson for people.

arabic_text: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proofs,

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ
translation: But he and his supporters turned away, and he said about [Moses], “A magician or a madman!”

arabic_text: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
translation: So We seized him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy[10].
footnotes: [10] For his disbelief and arrogance.

arabic_text: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] ‘Ād, when We sent against them the devastating barren wind[11].
footnotes: [11] Devoid of all goodness such as carrying rain or fertilizing trees.

arabic_text: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
translation: It spared nothing it came upon except that it reduced it to ruin and decay.

arabic_text: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
translation: And [there is a sign in the story of] Thamūd, when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves for a while[12].”
footnotes: [12] i.e., only three days. See 11:65.

arabic_text: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
translation: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them, while they were looking on.

arabic_text: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ
translation: They could not withstand it, nor could they ward it off.

arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
translation: And the people of Noah [were also destroyed] before them. They were indeed a rebellious people.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
translation: We built the heaven with might[13], and We are indeed expanding it.
footnotes: [13] ’Ayd does not mean "hands" here. This is not from the verses of Allah's attributes, for Allah Almighty did not add it to Himself, i.e., He did not say, "My ’ayd, or Our ’ayd".

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
translation: And We spread out the earth. How well did We smooth it out[14]!
footnotes: [14] The earth was spread out to accommodate the creatures. Its spherical shape is mentioned in 39:5.

arabic_text: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation: And We have created everything in pairs[15], so that you may take heed.
footnotes: [15] Such as day and night, male and female, light and darkness, sweet and bitter, hot and cold, etc.

arabic_text: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
translation: So flee to Allah[16]. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.
footnotes: [16] From His punishment to His reward by shunning disbelief and sin and by obeying Him.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
translation: And do not set up another god with Allah. Indeed, I am a clear warner to you from Him.”

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ
translation: Likewise, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician, or a madman!”

arabic_text: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
translation: Did they suggest this to one another[17]? Rather they are transgressing people.
footnotes: [17] i.e., Did the previous disbelievers pass on these false allegations to the pagans of Makkah so they repeat their words?

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
translation: So turn away from them [O Prophet], for you are not to blame[18].
footnotes: [18] After you have delivered the message.

arabic_text: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: But keep reminding them, for reminder benefits the believers.

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ
translation: I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

arabic_text: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ
translation: I seek no provision from them, nor do I want them to feed Me.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
translation: Indeed, it is Allah Who is the All-Provider[19], Lord of Power, the Mighty.
footnotes: [19] He Provides His creatures with everything they need. Among His provisions is guidance.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
translation: Indeed, those who do wrong will have a share [of punishment] like that of their predecessors, so let them not ask Me to hasten it.

arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
translation: So woe to those who disbelieve from [the punishment of] the Day which they are promised.

arabic_text: وَٱلطُّورِ
translation: By the mount of Tūr[1],
footnotes: [1] Where Allah Almighty communicated with Moses (عليه السلام).

arabic_text: وَكِتَٰبٖ مَّسۡطُورٖ
translation: and by the Book inscribed[2]
footnotes: [2] i.e., the Qur’an.

arabic_text: فِي رَقّٖ مَّنشُورٖ
translation: on an unrolled parchment[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., a spread-out scroll.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡمُورِ
translation: and by the much-frequented House[4],
footnotes: [4] Which is frequented by angels or the Ka‘bah in Makkah which is frequented by pilgrims.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّقۡفِ ٱلۡمَرۡفُوعِ
translation: and by the canopy raised high,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡبَحۡرِ ٱلۡمَسۡجُورِ
translation: and by the sea set on fire[5].
footnotes: [5] On the Day of Resurrection, or "by the overflowed sea."

arabic_text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
translation: The punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass;

arabic_text: مَّا لَهُۥ مِن دَافِعٖ
translation: there is none who can avert it.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَمُورُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ مَوۡرٗا
translation: On the Day when the heaven will convulse violently[6],
footnotes: [6] The heavens will be shaken violently, indicating the occurrence of the Hour. The word "maur" originally means turning round, rotating, swinging, swaying, etc.

arabic_text: وَتَسِيرُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ سَيۡرٗا
translation: and the mountains will move a horrible movement[7].
footnotes: [7] They will turn into dust, moving as clouds.

arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Then woe to the deniers on that Day,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي خَوۡضٖ يَلۡعَبُونَ
translation: those who amuse themselves in falsehood.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
translation: On the Day when they will be shoved into the Fire forcefully,

arabic_text: هَٰذِهِ ٱلنَّارُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: [They will be told,] “This is the Fire which you used to deny.

arabic_text: أَفَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَآ أَمۡ أَنتُمۡ لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
translation: Is this [punishment] magic, or do you not see?

arabic_text: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا فَٱصۡبِرُوٓاْ أَوۡ لَا تَصۡبِرُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ إِنَّمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: Burn in it, whether you bear it patiently or impatiently, it makes no difference to you[8]; you are recompensed only for what you used to do.”
footnotes: [8] He who is patient during afflictions in the life of this world will be rewarded. As for the Hereafter, suffering patiently in Hell will not bring any reward or benefit.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَعِيمٖ
translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and bliss,

arabic_text: فَٰكِهِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ وَوَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you used to do,

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّصۡفُوفَةٖۖ وَزَوَّجۡنَٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٖ
translation: reclining on couches all lined up”. And We will marry them to houris with wide beautiful eyes.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱتَّبَعَتۡهُمۡ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَٰنٍ أَلۡحَقۡنَا بِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ وَمَآ أَلَتۡنَٰهُم مِّنۡ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيۡءٖۚ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيِٕۭ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٞ
translation: As for those who believe and their offspring follow them in faith, We will cause their offspring to join them, and will not detract anything from [the reward of] their deeds. Everyone will be accountable for what he earned[9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., None will be held responsible for the burden of another.

arabic_text: وَأَمۡدَدۡنَٰهُم بِفَٰكِهَةٖ وَلَحۡمٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ
translation: And We will provide them with whatever fruit and meat they desire.

arabic_text: يَتَنَٰزَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا لَّا لَغۡوٞ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمٞ
translation: They will pass around to one another a glass [of pure wine] which does not lead to idle talk or sin.

arabic_text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ غِلۡمَانٞ لَّهُمۡ كَأَنَّهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ
translation: They will be served by their servant boys, as if they were well-protected pearls.

arabic_text: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
translation: They will turn to one another with questions[10].
footnotes: [10] They will probably ask one another about their worldly lives and what led them to Paradise.

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبۡلُ فِيٓ أَهۡلِنَا مُشۡفِقِينَ
translation: They will say, “Before this, we used to be in awe [of Allah] when we were living among our people.

arabic_text: فَمَنَّ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡنَا وَوَقَىٰنَا عَذَابَ ٱلسَّمُومِ
translation: Therefore Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبۡلُ نَدۡعُوهُۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡبَرُّ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
translation: Indeed, we used to call upon Him before. He is indeed the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”

arabic_text: فَذَكِّرۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِنِعۡمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٖ وَلَا مَجۡنُونٍ
translation: So keep exhorting [O Prophet], for you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٞ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِۦ رَيۡبَ ٱلۡمَنُونِ
translation: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await a misfortune[11]”?
footnotes: [11] i.e., inevitable death or so.

arabic_text: قُلۡ تَرَبَّصُواْ فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
translation: Say, “Wait, I too am waiting with you.”

arabic_text: أَمۡ تَأۡمُرُهُمۡ أَحۡلَٰمُهُم بِهَٰذَآۚ أَمۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
translation: Do their minds[12] prompt them to say such things, or are they transgressing people?
footnotes: [12] The leaders of pagans in Makkah claimed to be of great minds. Here it questions their intelligence, arguing that a man cannot be a madman and a poet at the same time.

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُۥۚ بَل لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
translation: Or do they say, “He has made this [Qur’an] up”? Rather, they are not willing to believe.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَأۡتُواْ بِحَدِيثٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦٓ إِن كَانُواْ صَٰدِقِينَ
translation: Then let them produce a discourse like this, if they are truthful[13].
footnotes: [13] Arab pagans were challenged to produce the like of this Quran, ten surahs, or one surah, but the challenge has never been met until the present day. See 2:23, 11:13, 52:34.

arabic_text: أَمۡ خُلِقُواْ مِنۡ غَيۡرِ شَيۡءٍ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ
translation: Were they created by none, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

arabic_text: أَمۡ خَلَقُواْ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
translation: Or did they create the heavens and earth? Rather, they are not certain in faith.

arabic_text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡمُصَۜيۡطِرُونَ
translation: Or do they possess the treasures of your Lord, or do they have full control [of everything]?

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ سُلَّمٞ يَسۡتَمِعُونَ فِيهِۖ فَلۡيَأۡتِ مُسۡتَمِعُهُم بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٍ
translation: Or do they have a stairway [to the heaven] by which they eavesdrop? Then let those who eavesdrop produce a compelling proof.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡبَنَٰتُ وَلَكُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ
translation: Or does He have daughters while you have sons[14]?
footnotes: [14] See footnote 37:149.

arabic_text: أَمۡ تَسۡـَٔلُهُمۡ أَجۡرٗا فَهُم مِّن مَّغۡرَمٖ مُّثۡقَلُونَ
translation: Or are you asking them [O Prophet] for a reward so they are overburdened by debt?

arabic_text: أَمۡ عِندَهُمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبُ فَهُمۡ يَكۡتُبُونَ
translation: Or do they have [the knowledge of] the unseen so they are writing it down?

arabic_text: أَمۡ يُرِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗاۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡمَكِيدُونَ
translation: Or do they intend a plot [against the Prophet]? But the plot of the disbelievers will rebound against themselves.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَهُمۡ إِلَٰهٌ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
translation: Or do they have a god other than Allah? Glory be to Allah far above what they associate with Him.

arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ كِسۡفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ سَاقِطٗا يَقُولُواْ سَحَابٞ مَّرۡكُومٞ
translation: If they were to see pieces of the sky falling down[15], they would still say, “[This is only] a mass of clouds.”
footnotes: [15] As a sign of the punishment that they requested.

arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي فِيهِ يُصۡعَقُونَ
translation: So leave them alone until they encounter their Day in which they will be struck down[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., they will be punished on the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
translation: the Day their plots will not avail them in the least, nor will they be helped.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ عَذَابٗا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: And for the wrongdoers, there will be another punishment before that[17], but most of them do not know.
footnotes: [17] In this world such as famine, droughts, or defeat at the battle, or punishment in the grave.

arabic_text: وَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعۡيُنِنَاۖ وَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
translation: Be patient [O Prophet] with your Lord’s decree, for indeed you are under Our [Watchful] Eyes. And glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.

arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَسَبِّحۡهُ وَإِدۡبَٰرَ ٱلنُّجُومِ
translation: And glorify Him at night and when the stars fade away[18].
footnotes: [18] i.e., the early hours of the morning when the stars set; the time of the Fajr Prayer.

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّجۡمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
translation: By the star when it sets,

arabic_text: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمۡ وَمَا غَوَىٰ
translation: Your companion [i.e., the Prophet] has neither strayed nor is he deluded.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَنطِقُ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰٓ
translation: Nor does he speak out of his own desire.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحۡيٞ يُوحَىٰ
translation: It is but a revelation sent down [to him].

arabic_text: عَلَّمَهُۥ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡقُوَىٰ
translation: He was taught by [an angel of] mighty power[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the angel Gabriel.

arabic_text: ذُو مِرَّةٖ فَٱسۡتَوَىٰ
translation: and of great perfection[2], who manifested himself [in his true form][3]
footnotes:
[2] i.e., the strength of body and mind.
 [3] Archangel Gabriel appeared to the Prophet (ﷺ) only twice in his angelic form: once at the outset of the Prophet’s mission (as he manifested himself, filling the horizon, so the Prophet (ﷺ) lost his consciousness), and another time during the Prophet’s ascension to the seventh heaven where he directly received from Allah the order to pray five times a day. See 17:1.

arabic_text: وَهُوَ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ
translation: when he was on the higher horizon[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., above the eastern horizon in the sky where the sun rises.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ
translation: Then he approached [the Prophet] and descended,

arabic_text: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوۡسَيۡنِ أَوۡ أَدۡنَىٰ
translation: until he was only two bow-lengths away or even closer.

arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦ مَآ أَوۡحَىٰ
translation: Then he revealed to His slave[5] what he had to reveal.
footnotes: [5] i.e., the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

arabic_text: مَا كَذَبَ ٱلۡفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰٓ
translation: The [Prophet’s] heart[6] did not deny what he saw.
footnotes: [6] i.e., his mind or perception.

arabic_text: أَفَتُمَٰرُونَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
translation: Do you dispute with him concerning what he saw?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ نَزۡلَةً أُخۡرَىٰ
translation: He certainly saw him a second time[7]
footnotes: [7] i.e., During his ascent (al-Mi‘rāj) to the heavens, he saw Gabriel in his true angelic form.

arabic_text: عِندَ سِدۡرَةِ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ
translation: at the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary [in the seventh heaven]

arabic_text: عِندَهَا جَنَّةُ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰٓ
translation: near which is the Garden of Abode,

arabic_text: إِذۡ يَغۡشَى ٱلسِّدۡرَةَ مَا يَغۡشَىٰ
translation: when the Lote Tree was overwhelmed with [divine] splendors.

arabic_text: مَا زَاغَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ
translation: His gaze did not wander, nor did it look beyond the limit.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ رَأَىٰ مِنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰٓ
translation: He certainly saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱللَّٰتَ وَٱلۡعُزَّىٰ
translation: Have you [O disbelievers] thought about [the idols of] Lāt and ‘Uzzā,

arabic_text: وَمَنَوٰةَ ٱلثَّالِثَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰٓ
translation: and Manāt, the third one as well[8]?
footnotes: [8] These were three well-known idols or goddesses worshiped by Arab pagans before the advent of Islam.

arabic_text: أَلَكُمُ ٱلذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ
translation: Do you choose for yourselves males and for Him females?

arabic_text: تِلۡكَ إِذٗا قِسۡمَةٞ ضِيزَىٰٓ
translation: That is then an unfair division!

arabic_text: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّآ أَسۡمَآءٞ سَمَّيۡتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ
translation: These [idols] are no more than names you and your forefathers have made up[9], for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and what their souls desire, although there has come to them guidance from their Lord.
footnotes: [9] i.e., You have considered them gods while in fact, they are not.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
translation: Is it that man can get whatever he wishes for[10]?
footnotes: [10] The pagans worshiped these idols wishing that they would intercede for them on the Day of Resurrection. See 39:3.

arabic_text: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ
translation: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and this world.

arabic_text: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغۡنِي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن يَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرۡضَىٰٓ
translation: How many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will be of no avail except after Allah’s permission to whom He wills and pleases.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسۡمِيَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ
translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels female names.

arabic_text: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـٔٗا
translation: They have no knowledge about it. They only follow conjecture, but conjecture is of no avail against the truth.

arabic_text: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ يُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
translation: So pay no heed to those who turn away from Our message[11] and who only seek the life of this world.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the Qur’an.

arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ
translation: That is the limit of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way, and He knows best who is guided.

arabic_text: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔواْ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى
translation: To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, so that He may recompense the evildoers for what they did, and reward those who do good with the best reward[12],
footnotes: [12] i.e., Paradise.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةٞ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓاْ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
translation: those who avoid major sins and shameful acts, except for minor lapses. Indeed, your Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you best, as He created you from the earth[13] and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers[14]. So do not claim purity for yourselves, for He knows best who is truly righteous.
footnotes:
[13] i.e., created your father, Adam.
 [14] See footnote 31:34.

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ
translation: Have you seen the one who turned away [from Islam],

arabic_text: وَأَعۡطَىٰ قَلِيلٗا وَأَكۡدَىٰٓ
translation: who gave a little, and then stopped?

arabic_text: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلۡمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
translation: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he has insight[15]?
footnotes: [15] i.e., the knowledge that his wealth will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allah has promised that it nourishes wealth.

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَمۡ يُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
translation: Or has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of Moses,

arabic_text: وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِي وَفَّىٰٓ
translation: and of Abraham, who fulfilled his duty?

arabic_text: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰ
translation: That no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another,

arabic_text: وَأَن لَّيۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
translation: and that man will not receive except what he strives for,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّ سَعۡيَهُۥ سَوۡفَ يُرَىٰ
translation: and that his efforts will be examined,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُجۡزَىٰهُ ٱلۡجَزَآءَ ٱلۡأَوۡفَىٰ
translation: then he will be recompensed in full,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ
translation: and that to your Lord is the final return,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضۡحَكَ وَأَبۡكَىٰ
translation: and that He is the One Who makes people laugh and weep[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., brings happiness or sadness to people.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحۡيَا
translation: and that He is the One Who causes death and gives life,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰ
translation: and that He created the pairs, male and female,

arabic_text: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ إِذَا تُمۡنَىٰ
translation: from a drop of sperm when it is emitted,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ
translation: and it is upon Him to bring about the second creation.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغۡنَىٰ وَأَقۡنَىٰ
translation: And He is the One Who enriches and bestows wealth,

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعۡرَىٰ
translation: and that He is the Lord of Sirius[17].
footnotes: [17] i.e., a star worshiped by some pagans before Islam.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهۡلَكَ عَادًا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ
translation: And that He destroyed the earlier ‘Ād[18],
footnotes: [18] i.e., the people of Prophet Hūd.

arabic_text: وَثَمُودَاْ فَمَآ أَبۡقَىٰ
translation: and Thamūd[19], sparing none,
footnotes: [19] i.e., the people of Prophet Sālih, who are called second Ād.

arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ
translation: and [He destroyed] the people of Noah before them; they were indeed more wicked and more rebellious.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَةَ أَهۡوَىٰ
translation: And He toppled the cities[20] upside down,
footnotes: [20] Of Sodom and Gomorrah whose dwellers defied Prophet Lot (عليه السلام).

arabic_text: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
translation: and they were utterly covered [by stones][21].
footnotes: [21] They were rained by stones.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?

arabic_text: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٞ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
translation: This [Prophet] is a warner like the earlier warners.

arabic_text: أَزِفَتِ ٱلۡأٓزِفَةُ
translation: The imminent Hour has drawn near,

arabic_text: لَيۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
translation: none but Allah can disclose it.

arabic_text: أَفَمِنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ تَعۡجَبُونَ
translation: Do you find this discourse astonishing,

arabic_text: وَتَضۡحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبۡكُونَ
translation: and you laugh [at it] and not weep,

arabic_text: وَأَنتُمۡ سَٰمِدُونَ
translation: while heedlessly lost in amusement?

arabic_text: فَٱسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلَّهِۤ وَٱعۡبُدُواْ۩
translation: So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].

arabic_text: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
translation: The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split asunder[1].
footnotes: [1] The Quraysh pagans challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) to split the moon in two so that they believe in him. The moon was split as they requested and then re-joined, and the incident was reported by several eyewitnesses in different parts of the land; however, they still refused to believe, considering it magic.

arabic_text: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ
translation: Whenever they see a sign[2], they turn away and say, “Same old magic!”
footnotes: [2] The prophets were given signs or miracles as a proof that they were commissioned by Allah. Moses (عليه السلام) was given the miracles of staff and a bright hand. Jesus (عليه السلام) would give life to the dead and heal the blind and the leper. Muhammad (ﷺ) was given the Qur’an, a literary miracle, challenging the masters of Arabic eloquence. Nonetheless, he (ﷺ) performed other miracles such as splitting the moon, increasing food and water, and healing some ailments.

arabic_text: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ
translation: They deny [the truth] and follow their desires, but every matter will reach its inevitable end.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ
translation: There have already come to them stories [of destroyed nations] that are sufficient to deter them,

arabic_text: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
translation: which contain extensive wisdom, but the warnings are of no avail.

arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ
translation: So turn away from them [O Prophet]. On the Day when the caller[3] will summon them to a horrific event[4],
footnotes: [3] Isrāfīl, the angel assigned to blow the Trumpet and call all for resurrection. [4] i.e., Judgment Day.

arabic_text: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ
translation: with eyes downcast, they will come out of the graves like scattered locusts,

arabic_text: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ
translation: rushing headlong towards the caller. The disbelievers will say, “This is a hard Day!”

arabic_text: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ
translation: The people of Noah rejected [the truth] before them; they rejected Our slave and said, “He is a madman,” and he was intimidated.

arabic_text: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ
translation: So he called upon his Lord, “I am overpowered, so help me!”

arabic_text: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ
translation: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,

arabic_text: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ
translation: and We caused the earth to burst forth with springs, then the waters met for a preordained purpose.

arabic_text: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ
translation: We carried him on an [Ark made] of planks and nails,

arabic_text: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
translation: sailing under Our [Watchful] Eyes; as a reward for the one [they] denied.

arabic_text: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have certainly left it[5] as a sign; is there anyone to take heed?
footnotes: [5] i.e., the punishment, the Flood, or the Ark.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: Then how were My punishment and My warnings[6]?
footnotes: [6] As a warning to those who came after them.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: ‘Ād disbelieved. Then how were My punishment and My warnings?

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ
translation: We sent against them a furious wind[7] on a day of continuous misfortune,
footnotes: [7] i.e., a tumultuous and screaming wind.

arabic_text: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ
translation: sweeping people away[8], as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.
footnotes: [8] i.e., extracting them from the earth.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: Then how were My punishment and My warnings?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
translation: Thamūd rejected the warnings,

arabic_text: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ
translation: They said, “Shall we follow a single human being[9] from among us? Then we would surely be in error and insanity!
footnotes: [9] i.e., Prophet Sālih (عليه السلام).

arabic_text: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ
translation: Has the revelation been sent down upon him out of all of us? Rather, he is an insolent liar.”

arabic_text: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ
translation: Tomorrow they will know who the insolent liar is.

arabic_text: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ
translation: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them, so watch them [O Sālih] and be patient,

arabic_text: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ
translation: and tell them that the water is to be shared between them[10]; each should take its drink in turn.
footnotes: [10] i.e., one day for the tribe of Thamūd and one day for the she-camel.

arabic_text: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
translation: But they called their companion[11], and he undertook the task[12] and hamstrung her.
footnotes:
[11] i.e., the worst among them.
 [12] Or took his sword.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: Then how [terrible] My punishment and My warnings were!

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ
translation: We sent against them a single blast, leaving them like trampled hedge-building twigs[13].
footnotes: [13] The people of Thamūd were crushed like trampled and trodden twigs and pieces of bush lying around an enclosure for cattle.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
translation: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ
translation: We sent against them a storm of pebbles, except the family of Lot whom We saved before dawn,

arabic_text: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ
translation: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
translation: He had already warned them of Our punishing assault, but they doubted the warnings.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: They even demanded that he let them have their way with his angel-guests[14], so We blinded their eyes, [saying], “Taste My punishment and My warnings!”
footnotes: [14] Whom Allah sent in the form of handsome young men.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ
translation: By the early morning a lasting torment overtook them.

arabic_text: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
translation: Taste My punishment and My warnings!

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have certainly made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember; is there anyone to take heed?

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
translation: Indeed, warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.

arabic_text: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ
translation: But they rejected all of Our signs, so We seized them with the grip of the All-Mighty, Most Powerful.

arabic_text: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
translation: Are your disbelievers [O Makkans] superior to those[15] or have you been granted immunity in divine Scriptures?
footnotes: [15] i.e., those destroyed peoples.

arabic_text: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ
translation: Or do they say, “We are a united front, bound to prevail.”?

arabic_text: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
translation: Soon their united front will be defeated, and they will flee[16].
footnotes: [16] This foretold event was fulfilled in the Battle of Badr.

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
translation: But the Hour is their appointed time, and the Hour is more catastrophic and more bitter.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ
translation: Indeed, the wicked are in error and madness[17].
footnotes: [17] Or "in the blazes of fire."

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
translation: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, [they will be told], “Taste the agony of Hell[18]!”
footnotes: [18] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.

arabic_text: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ
translation: We have surely created everything in a determined measure[19].
footnotes: [19] Or perfectly preordained.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ
translation: Our command is but a single word[20], which is fulfilled in the blink of an eye.
footnotes: [20] Our command when We want something, We only say, "Be," and it is.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
translation: We have destroyed many like you [O Makkans][21]; is there anyone to take heed?
footnotes: [21] In rejecting Allah's messengers.

arabic_text: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ
translation: Everything they did is in the written records,

arabic_text: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ
translation: and everything, small or big, is written down.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ
translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and rivers[22],
footnotes: [22] Rivers of water, honey, milk, and wine. See 47:15.

arabic_text: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ
translation: seated in honor in the presence of the Most Powerful Sovereign.

arabic_text: ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ
translation: The Most Compassionate,

arabic_text: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ
translation: has taught the Qur’an,

arabic_text: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ
translation: He created man,

arabic_text: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلۡبَيَانَ
translation: and taught him speech.

arabic_text: ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ بِحُسۡبَانٖ
translation: The sun and the moon follow their precise courses,

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّجۡمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسۡجُدَانِ
translation: and the stars[1] and trees prostrate [to Allah][2].
footnotes:
[1] "Najm" is also a vegetation without a trunk, stalk, or stem.
 [2] i.e., they obediently submit to the laws of Allah. See 22:18.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ
translation: He raised the heaven and enjoined justice

arabic_text: أَلَّا تَطۡغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡمِيزَانِ
translation: so that you may not transgress the limits of justice.

arabic_text: وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُواْ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ
translation: Therefore establish weights in justice, and do not give short measure.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلۡأَنَامِ
translation: He has spread out the earth for all creatures,

arabic_text: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَٱلنَّخۡلُ ذَاتُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَامِ
translation: in which there are fruits and palm trees with date stalks,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡحَبُّ ذُو ٱلۡعَصۡفِ وَٱلرَّيۡحَانُ
translation: and grain having chaff, and fragrant plants.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you[3] deny?
footnotes: [3] i.e., men and jinn.

arabic_text: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ
translation: He created man from dry clay like pottery,

arabic_text: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٖ مِّن نَّارٖ
translation: and He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقَيۡنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَغۡرِبَيۡنِ
translation: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ يَلۡتَقِيَانِ
translation: He merges the two seas meeting together[5],
footnotes: [5] Two bodies of water or two sea waters of fresh and salty water.

arabic_text: بَيۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخٞ لَّا يَبۡغِيَانِ
translation: yet between them is a barrier so that they do not cross[6].
footnotes: [6] See footnote 25:53.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُمَا ٱللُّؤۡلُؤُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ
translation: Out of both of them emerge pearls and coral.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَٰمِ
translation: To Him belong the sailing ships raised up in the sea like mountains.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: كُلُّ مَنۡ عَلَيۡهَا فَانٖ
translation: Everyone on earth will perish,

arabic_text: وَيَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
translation: but there will remain the Face of your Lord[7], full of Majesty and Honor.
footnotes: [7] i.e., your Lord Himself.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ يَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأۡنٖ
translation: All those in the heavens and earth ask of Him; every day He is engaged in some matters[8].
footnotes: [8] Such as giving life and causing death, enriching some and impoverishing others, elevating some and debasing others, etc.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: سَنَفۡرُغُ لَكُمۡ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ
translation: We will attend to you, O two multitudes [of men and jinn].

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: يَٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُواْ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُواْۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ
translation: O assembly of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the realms of the heavens and earth, then pass; you cannot pass without [Our] authority.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: يُرۡسَلُ عَلَيۡكُمَا شُوَاظٞ مِّن نَّارٖ وَنُحَاسٞ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
translation: There will be sent against you a flame of fire and smoke[9], and you will not be able to defend yourselves.
footnotes: [9] It could also mean liquefied brass or copper.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةٗ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
translation: When the heaven is split asunder and becomes crimson like [burnt] oil[10].
footnotes: [10] Or like tanned skin or molten brass.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٞ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: On that Day no human or jinn will be asked about his sin[11].
footnotes: [11] For Allah knows their sins; they will only be interrogated as a form of punishment.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: يُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمۡ فَيُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِي وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ
translation: The wicked will be known by their marks and will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ
translation: [They will be told] “This is the Hell that the wicked used to deny.”

arabic_text: يَطُوفُونَ بَيۡنَهَا وَبَيۡنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٖ
translation: They will go round between it and scalding water.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny[12]?
footnotes: [12] Warning of the punishment in Hell is listed here as a favor as a reminder that the believers should be cautious of it and be saved of it on the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: وَلِمَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
translation: For those who fear of standing before their Lord[13] will be two Gardens.
footnotes: [13] On the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: ذَوَاتَآ أَفۡنَانٖ
translation: Shaded by spreading branches.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ تَجۡرِيَانِ
translation: In each there are two flowing springs.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٖ زَوۡجَانِ
translation: In each there are two kinds of every fruit.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقٖۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَيۡنِ دَانٖ
translation: They will recline on couches lined with rich brocade, with the fruits of both gardens within reach.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: In them there will be maidens of restrained gaze[14], untouched[15] before them by any man or jinn.
footnotes:
[14] To their own mates, being chaste and modest.
 [15] Lit., the maidens have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلۡيَاقُوتُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ
translation: As if they were rubies and pearls[16].
footnotes: [16] In purity and beauty.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: هَلۡ جَزَآءُ ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنُ
translation: Is the reward for goodness anything but goodness?

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
translation: And besides these two there will be two other gardens.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: مُدۡهَآمَّتَانِ
translation: Both of the deepest green.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
translation: In each there are two gushing springs.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَنَخۡلٞ وَرُمَّانٞ
translation: In each there are fruits, palm trees, and pomegranates.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: فِيهِنَّ خَيۡرَٰتٌ حِسَانٞ
translation: In them there are beautiful noble women.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: حُورٞ مَّقۡصُورَٰتٞ فِي ٱلۡخِيَامِ
translation: Maidens with gorgeous eyes, reserved in pavilions.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
translation: No human or jinn has ever touched them before.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرٖ وَعَبۡقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٖ
translation: [They will be] reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord will you deny?

arabic_text: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
translation: Blessed is the Name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Honor.

arabic_text: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ
translation: When the Inevitable Event comes to pass,

arabic_text: لَيۡسَ لِوَقۡعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ
translation: there will be none to deny its occurrence;

arabic_text: خَافِضَةٞ رَّافِعَةٌ
translation: it will bring some low and raise others up[1].
footnotes: [1] According to their deeds rather than wealth and social position, as is the case in this world. The righteous will be elevated in Paradise and the wicked will be debased in Hell.

arabic_text: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ رَجّٗا
translation: When the earth is shaken violently,

arabic_text: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ بَسّٗا
translation: and the mountains crushed to pieces,

arabic_text: فَكَانَتۡ هَبَآءٗ مُّنۢبَثّٗا
translation: and turn to scattered dust,

arabic_text: وَكُنتُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا ثَلَٰثَةٗ
translation: then you are sorted into three groups:

arabic_text: فَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
translation: the people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right[2]!
footnotes: [2] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the right hand and are destined for Paradise.

arabic_text: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
translation: The people of the left – how miserable will be the people of the left[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., those who receive their record of deeds in the left hand and are destined for Hell.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ
translation: And the forerunners [in faith] are the forerunners [in Paradise].

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation: They are the nearest ones [to Allah],

arabic_text: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
translation: in Gardens of Bliss,

arabic_text: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: many from the early generations,

arabic_text: وَقَلِيلٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
translation: and a few from the later generations.

arabic_text: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّوۡضُونَةٖ
translation: [They will be seated] on jeweled couches,

arabic_text: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيۡهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ
translation: reclining on them, facing one another.

arabic_text: يَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ
translation: They will be served by immortal youths

arabic_text: بِأَكۡوَابٖ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينٖ
translation: with cups, pitchers, and glasses [of wine] from a flowing spring,

arabic_text: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنۡهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ
translation: which will neither cause any headache nor intoxication,

arabic_text: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ
translation: along with fruits of their choice,

arabic_text: وَلَحۡمِ طَيۡرٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ
translation: and flesh of birds that they may desire.

arabic_text: وَحُورٌ عِينٞ
translation: And [they will have] maidens with wide gorgeous eyes,

arabic_text: كَأَمۡثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤۡلُوِٕ ٱلۡمَكۡنُونِ
translation: like pristine pearls,

arabic_text: جَزَآءَۢ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: as a reward for what they used to do.

arabic_text: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمًا
translation: They will not hear therein any idle talk or sinful speech,

arabic_text: إِلَّا قِيلٗا سَلَٰمٗا سَلَٰمٗا
translation: except the words of peace, peace[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., only exchanging greetings of peace.

arabic_text: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: The people of the right – how blessed will be the people of the right!

arabic_text: فِي سِدۡرٖ مَّخۡضُودٖ
translation: [They will be] in the midst of thornless lote trees,

arabic_text: وَطَلۡحٖ مَّنضُودٖ
translation: and clusters of bananas,

arabic_text: وَظِلّٖ مَّمۡدُودٖ
translation: and extended shade,

arabic_text: وَمَآءٖ مَّسۡكُوبٖ
translation: and flowing water,

arabic_text: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ
translation: and abundant fruit –

arabic_text: لَّا مَقۡطُوعَةٖ وَلَا مَمۡنُوعَةٖ
translation: neither ceasing nor restricted –

arabic_text: وَفُرُشٖ مَّرۡفُوعَةٍ
translation: and elevated mattresses [on beds].

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَنشَأۡنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءٗ
translation: Indeed, We have perfectly created them [i.e., their spouses],

arabic_text: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُنَّ أَبۡكَارًا
translation: and have made them virgins,

arabic_text: عُرُبًا أَتۡرَابٗا
translation: loving and of equal age,

arabic_text: لِّأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: for the people of the right,

arabic_text: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: many from the earlier generations,

arabic_text: وَثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
translation: and many from the later generations.

arabic_text: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ
translation: And the people of the left – how wretched will be the people of the left!

arabic_text: فِي سَمُومٖ وَحَمِيمٖ
translation: [They will be] in scorching wind and scalding water,

arabic_text: وَظِلّٖ مِّن يَحۡمُومٖ
translation: in the shade of black smoke,

arabic_text: لَّا بَارِدٖ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ
translation: neither cool nor refreshing.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتۡرَفِينَ
translation: Indeed, they used to be in luxuries before,

arabic_text: وَكَانُواْ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلۡحِنثِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: and persisted in the gravest sin[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., Shirk (associating partners with Allah) or disbelief.

arabic_text: وَكَانُواْ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ
translation: They used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, will we really be raised again?

arabic_text: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ
translation: And our forefathers as well?”

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
translation: Say, [O Prophet], “Indeed, the former and later generations

arabic_text: لَمَجۡمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
translation: will be gathered on a predetermined Day.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: Then you, O misguided deniers,

arabic_text: لَأٓكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٖ مِّن زَقُّومٖ
translation: will surely eat from the tree of zaqqūm[6],
footnotes: [6] See footnote 44:43-46.

arabic_text: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ
translation: filling your bellies with it,

arabic_text: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيۡهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ
translation: and drinking scalding water on top of it,

arabic_text: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرۡبَ ٱلۡهِيمِ
translation: drinking like thirsty camels do.”

arabic_text: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ فَلَوۡلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ
translation: It is We Who created you; why do you not then believe [in resurrection]?

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تُمۡنُونَ
translation: Have you thought about the semen that you emit?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَخۡلُقُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ
translation: Is it you who create it, or is it We Who are the Creators?

arabic_text: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَيۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ
translation: We have ordained death among you, and nothing can overcome us

arabic_text: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمۡثَٰلَكُمۡ وَنُنشِئَكُمۡ فِي مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: from transforming you and recreating you in forms that you do not know[7].
footnotes: [7] Or "from replacing you by others like yourselves [in this life] and creating you [in the Hereafter] in that which you do not know."

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ فَلَوۡلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation: You are well aware of the first creation; why do you not then take heed?

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تَحۡرُثُونَ
translation: Have you thought about what you sow?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَزۡرَعُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلزَّٰرِعُونَ
translation: Is it you who cause it to grow, or is it We Who make it grow?

arabic_text: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ حُطَٰمٗا فَظَلۡتُمۡ تَفَكَّهُونَ
translation: If We willed, We could reduce your harvest to rubble, leaving you to wonder and lament,

arabic_text: إِنَّا لَمُغۡرَمُونَ
translation: “We suffered loss,

arabic_text: بَلۡ نَحۡنُ مَحۡرُومُونَ
translation: rather, we are deprived.”

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَآءَ ٱلَّذِي تَشۡرَبُونَ
translation: Have you thought about the water that you drink?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنزَلۡتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُزۡنِ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنزِلُونَ
translation: Is it you who bring it down from the clouds, or is it We Who bring it down?

arabic_text: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ جَعَلۡنَٰهُ أُجَاجٗا فَلَوۡلَا تَشۡكُرُونَ
translation: If We willed, We could make it salty; will you not then give thanks?

arabic_text: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِي تُورُونَ
translation: Have you thought about the fire that you kindle?

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنشَأۡتُمۡ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنشِـُٔونَ
translation: Is it you who produced its trees[8], or is it We Who produced it?
footnotes: [8] Referring to Arabian trees, markh and ‘afār, which produce fire when their green branches are rubbed against each other.

arabic_text: نَحۡنُ جَعَلۡنَٰهَا تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَمَتَٰعٗا لِّلۡمُقۡوِينَ
translation: We made it a reminder [of the Hellfire] and a benefit for the travelers[9].
footnotes: [9] By which they ignite fire. Travelers are mentioned in particular because it is of special convenience to them, although it is of use for all people in general.

arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: So glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

arabic_text: ۞ فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَوَٰقِعِ ٱلنُّجُومِ
translation: I do swear[10] by the positions of the stars –
footnotes: [10] The negative article "la" (nay) means: The truth is not what is said or thought by disbelievers or others. The oath refutes certain objections of the disbelievers with regard to the Qur’an.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَقَسَمٞ لَّوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ
translation: and this is indeed a great oath, if only you knew –

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ لَقُرۡءَانٞ كَرِيمٞ
translation: that this is indeed a noble Qur’an,

arabic_text: فِي كِتَٰبٖ مَّكۡنُونٖ
translation: in a well-preserved Record[11],
footnotes: [11] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.

arabic_text: لَّا يَمَسُّهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلۡمُطَهَّرُونَ
translation: that none can touch except the purified ones[12] –
footnotes: [12] i.e., angels. It refutes the claim of the pagans that the Qur’an was sent down by devils. (See 26:210-212). Based on this verse, many Muslim jurists held that one should perform ablution prior to reading the Qur’an.

arabic_text: تَنزِيلٞ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

arabic_text: أَفَبِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ أَنتُم مُّدۡهِنُونَ
translation: Do you take this discourse lightly,

arabic_text: وَتَجۡعَلُونَ رِزۡقَكُمۡ أَنَّكُمۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: and instead [of thanking Allah] for the provision you are given, you show ingratitude?

arabic_text: فَلَوۡلَآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلۡحُلۡقُومَ
translation: Then why [are you helpless] when the soul reaches the throat,

arabic_text: وَأَنتُمۡ حِينَئِذٖ تَنظُرُونَ
translation: while you are looking on,

arabic_text: وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَيۡهِ مِنكُمۡ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبۡصِرُونَ
translation: when We are closer[13] to him than you, but you do not see?
footnotes: [13] We are closer to him in terms of Knowledge and Power; Our angels are closer in person.

arabic_text: فَلَوۡلَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ غَيۡرَ مَدِينِينَ
translation: If you are not subject to retribution, then why do you not

arabic_text: تَرۡجِعُونَهَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
translation: bring that [soul] back, if you are truthful?

arabic_text: فَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ
translation: If that dying person is one of those who will be brought near to Allah,

arabic_text: فَرَوۡحٞ وَرَيۡحَانٞ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٖ
translation: then [he will have] comfort, fragrance[14], and a Garden of Bliss.
footnotes: [14] lit., fragrant basil. Paradise is described in the Qur’an as being pleasant to the eye, the heart, and the ear. Here it also emphasizes the scent.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: If he is one of the people of the right,

arabic_text: فَسَلَٰمٞ لَّكَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: [He will be told], “Peace be to you, for being one of the people of the right.”

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
translation: But if he is one of the misguided deniers,

arabic_text: فَنُزُلٞ مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ
translation: then he will be welcomed with scalding water,

arabic_text: وَتَصۡلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ
translation: and he will burn in Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
translation: This is indeed the absolute truth.

arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

arabic_text: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
translation: All that is in the heavens and earth glorifies[1] Allah, for He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
footnotes: [1] By praising and exalting Him far above any deficiency or imperfection.

arabic_text: لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ
translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth; He gives life and causes death, and He is Most Capable of all things.

arabic_text: هُوَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُ وَٱلۡأٓخِرُ وَٱلظَّٰهِرُ وَٱلۡبَاطِنُۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٌ
translation: He is the First[2] and the Last[3], the Manifest[4] and the Hidden[5], and He is All-Knowing of everything.
footnotes: [2] Before Whom nothing existed; the foremost; the uppermost. [3] Eternal after Whom nothing remains. [4] High, nothing is above Him. [5] Nothing is nearer than Him by way of His knowledge; concealed from our physical senses.

arabic_text: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ يَعۡلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا يَعۡرُجُ فِيهَاۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِيرٞ
translation: It is He Who created the heavens and earth in six days, and then rose over the Throne. He knows all that goes into the earth and all that comes out of it, and all that descends from the heaven and all that ascends to it. He is with you[6] wherever you are, and Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.
footnotes: [6] By His Knowledge - observing and witnessing all.

arabic_text: لَّهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرۡجَعُ ٱلۡأُمُورُ
translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and to Allah will return all matters.

arabic_text: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيۡلَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِي ٱلَّيۡلِۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
translation: He causes the night to merge into the day and the day to merge into the night, and He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.

arabic_text: ءَامِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَأَنفِقُواْ مِمَّا جَعَلَكُم مُّسۡتَخۡلَفِينَ فِيهِۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنكُمۡ وَأَنفَقُواْ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٞ
translation: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend [in Allah’s cause] out of what He has entrusted you with. For those among you who believe and spend[7], there will be a great reward.
footnotes: [7] In the way of Allah.

arabic_text: وَمَا لَكُمۡ لَا تُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدۡعُوكُمۡ لِتُؤۡمِنُواْ بِرَبِّكُمۡ وَقَدۡ أَخَذَ مِيثَٰقَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
translation: Why is it that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger is calling you to believe in your Lord, and He has already taken a covenant from you[8], if you will ever believe?

arabic_text: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦٓ ءَايَٰتِۭ بَيِّنَٰتٖ لِّيُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمۡ لَرَءُوفٞ رَّحِيمٞ
translation: It is He Who sends down clear verses to His slave to bring you out of the depths of darkness into the light. Indeed, Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to you.

arabic_text: وَمَا لَكُمۡ أَلَّا تُنفِقُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَٰثُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ لَا يَسۡتَوِي مِنكُم مَّنۡ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبۡلِ ٱلۡفَتۡحِ وَقَٰتَلَۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَعۡظَمُ دَرَجَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنفَقُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدُ وَقَٰتَلُواْۚ وَكُلّٗا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
translation: Why is it that you do not spend in the cause of Allah, when Allah alone will inherit the heavens and earth? Those of you who spent and fought before the conquest [of Makkah and those who did not] are not equal. They are much greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterward[9]. Yet Allah has promised each a fine reward, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
footnotes: [9] Muslims were perceived as weak before the conquest of Makkah. Therefore, those believers who donated and fought in times of weakness and hardship deserve more rewards than those who did so when Muslims were victors and had an upper hand against the enemies.

arabic_text: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يُقۡرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا فَيُضَٰعِفَهُۥ لَهُۥ وَلَهُۥٓ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ
translation: Who is there to lend Allah a goodly loan, so He will multiply it for him, and for him there will be a generous reward[10]?
footnotes: [10] i.e., Paradise.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَرَى ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ يَسۡعَىٰ نُورُهُم بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَبِأَيۡمَٰنِهِمۖ بُشۡرَىٰكُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ
translation: [Remember] the Day when you will see the believing men and women, with their light streaming ahead of them and on their right. [They will be told], “Glad tidings for you Today: gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever.” That is the supreme triumph.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَقُولُ ٱلۡمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلۡمُنَٰفِقَٰتُ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱنظُرُونَا نَقۡتَبِسۡ مِن نُّورِكُمۡ قِيلَ ٱرۡجِعُواْ وَرَآءَكُمۡ فَٱلۡتَمِسُواْ نُورٗاۖ فَضُرِبَ بَيۡنَهُم بِسُورٖ لَّهُۥ بَابُۢ بَاطِنُهُۥ فِيهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَةُ وَظَٰهِرُهُۥ مِن قِبَلِهِ ٱلۡعَذَابُ
translation: On that Day the hypocrite men and women will say to those who believe, “Wait for us, so that we may have some of your light.” It will be said, “Go back and seek light elsewhere[11].” Then a wall will be placed between them, which will have a gate[12], on the inside of which there will be mercy and on the outside there will be punishment.
footnotes: [11] i.e., the worldly life from where the light was acquired. [12] This wall is said to be the barrier between Paradise and Hell, which is called Al-A‘rāf (the heights). See 7:46-49.

arabic_text: يُنَادُونَهُمۡ أَلَمۡ نَكُن مَّعَكُمۡۖ قَالُواْ بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمۡ فَتَنتُمۡ أَنفُسَكُمۡ وَتَرَبَّصۡتُمۡ وَٱرۡتَبۡتُمۡ وَغَرَّتۡكُمُ ٱلۡأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَ أَمۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡغَرُورُ
translation: The hypocrites will call out to the believers, “Were we not with you?” They will say, “Yes, but you allowed yourselves[13] to succumb to temptations, you awaited [some misfortune to befall us], you doubted, and you were deceived by false hopes, until Allah’s decree came to pass. Thus the deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning Allah.
footnotes: [13] By hypocrisy.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا يُؤۡخَذُ مِنكُمۡ فِدۡيَةٞ وَلَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۚ مَأۡوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُۖ هِيَ مَوۡلَىٰكُمۡۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
translation: So this Day no ransom will be accepted from you or from the disbelievers. Your abode is the Fire; it is a fitting place for you – what a wretched destination!”

arabic_text: ۞ أَلَمۡ يَأۡنِ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَن تَخۡشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمۡ لِذِكۡرِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡأَمَدُ فَقَسَتۡ قُلُوبُهُمۡۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ
translation: Has the time not yet come for those who believe that their hearts should be humbled at the remembrance of Allah and the truth that has been revealed? And that they should not be like those who were given the Scripture before, whose hearts grew hard after the passage of a long time, and many of them were evildoers.

arabic_text: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحۡيِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ مَوۡتِهَاۚ قَدۡ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
translation: Know that Allah revives the earth after its death[14]. We have made the signs clear to you so that you may understand.
footnotes: [14] Similarly, it is easy for Allah to soften the hearts and guide after misguidance.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَٱلۡمُصَّدِّقَٰتِ وَأَقۡرَضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا يُضَٰعَفُ لَهُمۡ وَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ
translation: Indeed, those men and women who give in charity and lend to Allah a goodly loan, it will be multiplied for them, and for them there will be a generous reward[15].
footnotes: [15] i.e., Paradise.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦٓ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصِّدِّيقُونَۖ وَٱلشُّهَدَآءُ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرُهُمۡ وَنُورُهُمۡۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: Those who believe in Allah and His messengers, it is they who are the people of the truth. And the martyrs will have their reward and their light with their Lord. As for those who disbelieve and reject Our verses, they are the people of the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا لَعِبٞ وَلَهۡوٞ وَزِينَةٞ وَتَفَاخُرُۢ بَيۡنَكُمۡ وَتَكَاثُرٞ فِي ٱلۡأَمۡوَٰلِ وَٱلۡأَوۡلَٰدِۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيۡثٍ أَعۡجَبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصۡفَرّٗا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَٰمٗاۖ وَفِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَغۡفِرَةٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضۡوَٰنٞۚ وَمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَآ إِلَّا مَتَٰعُ ٱلۡغُرُورِ
translation: Know that the life of this world is no more than play, amusement, adornment, boasting among yourselves, and competition in wealth and children. It is like plants that flourish after rain, pleasing the sowers, then they wither and you see them turning yellow, and then they crumble. And in the Hereafter there will be severe punishment, or forgiveness from Allah and His pleasure. For the life of this world is no more than a fleeting enjoyment.

arabic_text: سَابِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَغۡفِرَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرۡضُهَا كَعَرۡضِ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ أُعِدَّتۡ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضۡلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤۡتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلۡفَضۡلِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: Race one another towards forgiveness from your Lord and Paradise the width of which is like the width of the heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.

arabic_text: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٖ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا فِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡ إِلَّا فِي كِتَٰبٖ مِّن قَبۡلِ أَن نَّبۡرَأَهَآۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٞ
translation: No calamity befalls the earth or yourselves but it is already written in a Record[16] before We bring it into existence. That is indeed easy for Allah –
footnotes: [16] i.e., the Preserved Tablet.

arabic_text: لِّكَيۡلَا تَأۡسَوۡاْ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَفۡرَحُواْ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمۡۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخۡتَالٖ فَخُورٍ
translation: so that you may not grieve over what you have missed, nor exult over what He has given you, for Allah does not love anyone who is conceited and boastful –

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَبۡخَلُونَ وَيَأۡمُرُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ بِٱلۡبُخۡلِۗ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلۡغَنِيُّ ٱلۡحَمِيدُ
translation: those who are stingy and promote stinginess among people. And those who turn away[17], then Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
footnotes: [17] Refuse to spend in the way of Allah or refuse obedience to Him.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا رُسُلَنَا بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَأَنزَلۡنَا مَعَهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمِيزَانَ لِيَقُومَ ٱلنَّاسُ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِۖ وَأَنزَلۡنَا ٱلۡحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأۡسٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَنَٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعۡلَمَ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُۥ وَرُسُلَهُۥ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٞ
translation: We have sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and sent down with them the Scripture and the criteria of justice, so that the people may uphold justice. And We sent down iron, in which there is great might and benefits for people, so that Allah may make known those who help His cause and His messengers without seeing Him. Indeed, Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحٗا وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلۡكِتَٰبَۖ فَمِنۡهُم مُّهۡتَدٖۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ
translation: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood and Scripture to their offspring: some among them are guided, but most of them are evildoers.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ قَفَّيۡنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِم بِرُسُلِنَا وَقَفَّيۡنَا بِعِيسَى ٱبۡنِ مَرۡيَمَ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡإِنجِيلَۖ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوهُ رَأۡفَةٗ وَرَحۡمَةٗۚ وَرَهۡبَانِيَّةً ٱبۡتَدَعُوهَا مَا كَتَبۡنَٰهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ رِضۡوَٰنِ ٱللَّهِ فَمَا رَعَوۡهَا حَقَّ رِعَايَتِهَاۖ فَـَٔاتَيۡنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ أَجۡرَهُمۡۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ
translation: Then We sent Our messengers in their footsteps, and We sent after them Jesus, son of Mary; We gave him the Gospel and instilled kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. As for monasticism, they invented it – We did not prescribe it for them – seeking thereby Allah’s pleasure, yet they did not observe it faithfully. So We gave those who believed among them their reward, but most of them are evildoers.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَءَامِنُواْ بِرَسُولِهِۦ يُؤۡتِكُمۡ كِفۡلَيۡنِ مِن رَّحۡمَتِهِۦ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ نُورٗا تَمۡشُونَ بِهِۦ وَيَغۡفِرۡ لَكُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٞ
translation: O you who believe, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will give you a double share of His mercy and will give you a light by which you walk, and forgive you, for Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

arabic_text: لِّئَلَّا يَعۡلَمَ أَهۡلُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ أَلَّا يَقۡدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ مِّن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَنَّ ٱلۡفَضۡلَ بِيَدِ ٱللَّهِ يُؤۡتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلۡفَضۡلِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: [This is] so that the People of the Book may know that they have no power over anything of Allah’s bounty and that all bounty is in the Hands of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills, for Allah is the Lord of great bounty.

arabic_text: قَدۡ سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ قَوۡلَ ٱلَّتِي تُجَٰدِلُكَ فِي زَوۡجِهَا وَتَشۡتَكِيٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ يَسۡمَعُ تَحَاوُرَكُمَآۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعُۢ بَصِيرٌ
translation: Indeed, Allah has heard the words of the woman who was arguing with you [O Prophet] concerning her husband and was complaining to Allah. Allah has heard the discussion between the two of you, for Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing[1].
footnotes: [1] Khawlah bint Tha‘labah and her husband Aws ibn As-Sāmit had a disagreement. She came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and said that her husband made her unlawful to himself as the zahr (back) of his mother, which was a famous type of divorce in Arabia, called zihār. He (ﷺ) told her that he had not received any revelation in this regard. Finally, this Madinian surah was revealed, and abolished this ancient practice.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِنكُم مِّن نِّسَآئِهِم مَّا هُنَّ أُمَّهَٰتِهِمۡۖ إِنۡ أُمَّهَٰتُهُمۡ إِلَّا ٱلَّٰٓـِٔي وَلَدۡنَهُمۡۚ وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَيَقُولُونَ مُنكَرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡقَوۡلِ وَزُورٗاۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٞ
translation: As for those among you who divorce their wives by likening them to their mothers[2], they are not their mothers; their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. They utter words that are abhorrent and false, but Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Forgiving.
footnotes: [2] By saying to one's wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother," meaning unlawful to approach, which was abolished by the revelation of these verses.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِن نِّسَآئِهِمۡ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا قَالُواْ فَتَحۡرِيرُ رَقَبَةٖ مِّن قَبۡلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّاۚ ذَٰلِكُمۡ تُوعَظُونَ بِهِۦۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
translation: But those who divorce their wives by likening them to their mothers then retract what they said, they must free a slave before they are intimate with each other. This is what you are admonished, and Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

arabic_text: فَمَن لَّمۡ يَجِدۡ فَصِيَامُ شَهۡرَيۡنِ مُتَتَابِعَيۡنِ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّاۖ فَمَن لَّمۡ يَسۡتَطِعۡ فَإِطۡعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسۡكِينٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦۚ وَتِلۡكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِۗ وَلِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
translation: But whoever cannot afford this must fast for two consecutive months[3] before the couple have intimate relations with each other. But if he is unable to do that, he must feed sixty needy people. This is so that you may truly believe in Allah and His Messenger.
