footnotes: [1] The Striking Calamity is one of the names of the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ
translation: As for Thamūd, they were destroyed by a dreadful blast.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا عَادٞ فَأُهۡلِكُواْ بِرِيحٖ صَرۡصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٖ
translation: And as for ‘Ād, they were destroyed by a furious windstorm[2]
footnotes: [2] Or by a cold windstorm.

arabic_text: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ سَبۡعَ لَيَالٖ وَثَمَٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومٗاۖ فَتَرَى ٱلۡقَوۡمَ فِيهَا صَرۡعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٍ خَاوِيَةٖ
translation: which He unleashed against them for seven successive nights and eight days, so you would see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

arabic_text: فَهَلۡ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٖ
translation: Do you see any trace of them now?

arabic_text: وَجَآءَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَمَن قَبۡلَهُۥ وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَٰتُ بِٱلۡخَاطِئَةِ
translation: Also, Pharaoh and those who came before him, and the overturned cities [of Lot] committed the grave sin,

arabic_text: فَعَصَوۡاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ أَخۡذَةٗ رَّابِيَةً
translation: each disobeying the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a severe punishment.

arabic_text: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلۡمَآءُ حَمَلۡنَٰكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡجَارِيَةِ
translation: Indeed, when the floodwater overflowed, We carried you [O humans] in the sailing Ark[3],
footnotes: [3] Which was made by Noah with Allah's command.

arabic_text: لِنَجۡعَلَهَا لَكُمۡ تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٞ وَٰعِيَةٞ
translation: so that We might make it a reminder for you, and that attentive ears may take heed.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ نَفۡخَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ
translation: Then when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast,

arabic_text: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ
translation: and the earth and mountains are lifted up and crushed with a single blow,

arabic_text: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ
translation: on that Day the Inevitable Event will occur.

arabic_text: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِيَ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاهِيَةٞ
translation: And the sky will split asunder and will be frail[4] on that day,
footnotes: [4] i.e., weak and unstable.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرۡجَآئِهَاۚ وَيَحۡمِلُ عَرۡشَ رَبِّكَ فَوۡقَهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ ثَمَٰنِيَةٞ
translation: with the angels on all its sides, and on that Day, eight [mighty angels] will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُعۡرَضُونَ لَا تَخۡفَىٰ مِنكُمۡ خَافِيَةٞ
translation: On that day, you will be brought forth [before Allah], and none of your secrets will remain hidden.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقۡرَءُواْ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his right hand, he will say, “Here is my Record, read it!

arabic_text: إِنِّي ظَنَنتُ أَنِّي مُلَٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهۡ
translation: I was sure that I would meet my reckoning.”

arabic_text: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ
translation: So he will be in a pleasant life,

arabic_text: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ
translation: in a lofty garden,

arabic_text: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٞ
translation: with clustered fruit within his reach.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسۡلَفۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَيَّامِ ٱلۡخَالِيَةِ
translation: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully for what you did[5] in the days gone by.”
footnotes: [5] Lit., "advanced" anticipating the reward in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُوتَ كِتَٰبِيَهۡ
translation: As for the one who is given his Record in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I had not been given my Record,

arabic_text: وَلَمۡ أَدۡرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهۡ
translation: nor had I known anything of my reckoning!

arabic_text: يَٰلَيۡتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلۡقَاضِيَةَ
translation: Would that it [i.e., death] had been the end of me[6]!
footnotes: [6] Rather than a gateway to eternal life.

arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهۡۜ
translation: My wealth has been of no avail to me.

arabic_text: هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلۡطَٰنِيَهۡ
translation: My authority has vanished[7].”
footnotes: [7] i.e., I have no valid argument or authority today.

arabic_text: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
translation: [It will be said,] “Seize him and shackle him,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
translation: then make him burn in the Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ فِي سِلۡسِلَةٖ ذَرۡعُهَا سَبۡعُونَ ذِرَاعٗا فَٱسۡلُكُوهُ
translation: then tie him up with a chain of seventy cubits long.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: For he did not believe in Allah, the Most Great,

arabic_text: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ
translation: nor did he encourage feeding the needy.

arabic_text: فَلَيۡسَ لَهُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ هَٰهُنَا حَمِيمٞ
translation: So Today he will have no close friend here,

arabic_text: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنۡ غِسۡلِينٖ
translation: nor any food except the discharge of wounds,

arabic_text: لَّا يَأۡكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلۡخَٰطِـُٔونَ
translation: none will eat it except the sinners.”

arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
translation: I swear by what you can see.

arabic_text: وَمَا لَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
translation: and what you cannot see!

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ
translation: Indeed, this is the word of a noble Messenger[8],
footnotes: [8] i.e., recited by Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ).

arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَاعِرٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تُؤۡمِنُونَ
translation: and it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe!

arabic_text: وَلَا بِقَوۡلِ كَاهِنٖۚ قَلِيلٗا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
translation: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little do you take heed!

arabic_text: تَنزِيلٞ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيۡنَا بَعۡضَ ٱلۡأَقَاوِيلِ
translation: If he had falsely attributed something to Us,

arabic_text: لَأَخَذۡنَا مِنۡهُ بِٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: We would have surely seized him by the right hand[9],
footnotes: [9] Or "by [Our] Right Hand," i.e., Allah would have surely exacted revenge with might and power.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعۡنَا مِنۡهُ ٱلۡوَتِينَ
translation: then severed his aorta[10],
footnotes: [10] i.e., his life artery of the heart; causing immediate death.

arabic_text: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنۡ أَحَدٍ عَنۡهُ حَٰجِزِينَ
translation: and none of you could have rescued him.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذۡكِرَةٞ لِّلۡمُتَّقِينَ
translation: This [Qur’an] is indeed a reminder for those who are righteous.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّا لَنَعۡلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ
translation: And We surely know that some of you will be deniers,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسۡرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
translation: and it[11] will certainly be a source of regret for the disbelievers.
footnotes: [11] i.e., denying this Qur’an.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
translation: And this[12] is indeed the absolute truth.
footnotes: [12] i.e., this Qur’an.

arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

arabic_text: سَأَلَ سَآئِلُۢ بِعَذَابٖ وَاقِعٖ
translation: A challenger asked for a punishment bound to come[1]
footnotes: [1] In the Hereafter. The pagans of Makkah had challenged the Prophet (ﷺ) in ridicule by asking Allah to bring upon them His punishment. See 8:32.

arabic_text: لِّلۡكَٰفِرِينَ لَيۡسَ لَهُۥ دَافِعٞ
translation: upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,

arabic_text: مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ذِي ٱلۡمَعَارِجِ
translation: from Allah, Lord of the pathways of ascent,

arabic_text: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَيۡهِ فِي يَوۡمٖ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِينَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
translation: by which the angels and the Spirit[2] will ascend to Him on a Day[3] the length of which is fifty thousand years.
footnotes:
[2] i.e., the angel Gabriel.
 [3] The Day of Judgment will be an extremely long day.

arabic_text: فَٱصۡبِرۡ صَبۡرٗا جَمِيلًا
translation: So be patient [O Prophet] with beautiful patience.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ يَرَوۡنَهُۥ بَعِيدٗا
translation: Indeed, they see this [punishment] far off,

arabic_text: وَنَرَىٰهُ قَرِيبٗا
translation: but We see it to be close at hand.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَكُونُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ كَٱلۡمُهۡلِ
translation: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass[4]
footnotes: [4] Or "murky oil."

arabic_text: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ
translation: and the mountains will be like dyed wool[5],
footnotes: [5] While disintegrating.

arabic_text: وَلَا يَسۡـَٔلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمٗا
translation: and no close friend will ask about another,

arabic_text: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ يَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ يَفۡتَدِي مِنۡ عَذَابِ يَوۡمِئِذِۭ بِبَنِيهِ
translation: even though they will see one another. The wicked will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by offering his children,

arabic_text: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَأَخِيهِ
translation: and his wife and his brother,

arabic_text: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ ٱلَّتِي تُـٔۡوِيهِ
translation: and his kindred who stood by him,

arabic_text: وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
translation: and everyone on earth, just to save himself.

arabic_text: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
translation: By no means![6] It is a raging Flame,
footnotes: [6] An emphatic denial, meaning "It will never be."

arabic_text: نَزَّاعَةٗ لِّلشَّوَىٰ
translation: that will strip off the scalps[7].
footnotes: [7] Referring to the skin of the head or of the body extremities, which will be burned away by severe heat and flames.

arabic_text: تَدۡعُواْ مَنۡ أَدۡبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation: It will call everyone who turned their backs and disobeyed,

arabic_text: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوۡعَىٰٓ
translation: and amassed and hoarded wealth.

arabic_text: ۞ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
translation: Indeed, man was created impatient:

arabic_text: إِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلشَّرُّ جَزُوعٗا
translation: when evil befalls him, he bewails,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ ٱلۡخَيۡرُ مَنُوعًا
translation: but when good fortune comes his way, he becomes tight-fisted –

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ
translation: except those who pray,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ دَآئِمُونَ
translation: who are steadfast in their prayers;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ فِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
translation: and who give a due share[8] of their wealth
footnotes: [8] i.e., obligatory charity; zakah.

arabic_text: لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
translation: to the beggar and the dispossessed;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: and who firmly believe in the Day of Judgment;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ
translation: and those who fear the punishment of their Lord –

arabic_text: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمۡ غَيۡرُ مَأۡمُونٖ
translation: for none can feel secure from their Lord’s punishment –

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِفُرُوجِهِمۡ حَٰفِظُونَ
translation: and those who guard their private parts[9],
footnotes: [9] i.e., their chastity and honor from immoralities.

arabic_text: إِلَّا عَلَىٰٓ أَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَيۡرُ مَلُومِينَ
translation: except from their wives or bondwomen[10] whom they own, for then they are not to be blamed.
footnotes: [10] i.e., female slaves or slave-girls.

arabic_text: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَآءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ
translation: But whoever seeks beyond that, it is they who are the transgressors.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ لِأَمَٰنَٰتِهِمۡ وَعَهۡدِهِمۡ رَٰعُونَ
translation: and those who fulfill their trusts and pledges;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِشَهَٰدَٰتِهِمۡ قَآئِمُونَ
translation: and who are upright in their testimonies;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمۡ يُحَافِظُونَ
translation: and who take due care of their prayers;

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ مُّكۡرَمُونَ
translation: they will be honored in gardens[11].
footnotes: [11] Of Paradise.

arabic_text: فَمَالِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ قِبَلَكَ مُهۡطِعِينَ
translation: What is the matter with the disbelievers that they are rushing towards you [O Prophet][12],
footnotes: [12] i.e., rushing to deny you.

arabic_text: عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
translation: from the right and from the left, in crowds[13]?
footnotes: [13] Some pagans of Makkah gathered around the Prophet (ﷺ) mocking and opposing him, claiming that if there is in fact a Hereafter, they would enter Paradise before the believers.

arabic_text: أَيَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٖ
translation: Does everyone of them aspire to enter a garden of bliss?

arabic_text: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّمَّا يَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: By no means! We have created them from what they know[14].
footnotes: [14] i.e., from a disdained fluid.

arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَٰدِرُونَ
translation: I swear by the Lord of the sunrises and sunsets[15] that We are surely Capable
footnotes: [15] i.e., Allah is the One Who determines the daily points of sunrise and sunset according to each season by the rotation of the earth around its axis.

arabic_text: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيۡرٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ
translation: to replace them with others better than them, and none can escape Our decree.

arabic_text: فَذَرۡهُمۡ يَخُوضُواْ وَيَلۡعَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَٰقُواْ يَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
translation: So leave them to engage in their falsehood and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised;

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعٗا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٖ يُوفِضُونَ
translation: the Day when they will rush out of their graves as if they are racing towards an idol[16],
footnotes: [16] i.e., just as they used to race towards a newly appointed idol, to be among the first of its worshipers.

arabic_text: خَٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةٞۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِي كَانُواْ يُوعَدُونَ
translation: with their eyes downcast and overwhelmed with disgrace. That is the Day that they were promised.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَنۡ أَنذِرۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ
translation: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”

arabic_text: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِنِّي لَكُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٌ
translation: He said: “O my people, indeed I am a clear warner to you,

arabic_text: أَنِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
translation: that you worship Allah and fear Him, and obey me;

arabic_text: يَغۡفِرۡ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرۡكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمًّىۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا جَآءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُۚ لَوۡ كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: He will forgive you some of your sins and grant you respite until an appointed term[1]. Indeed, when Allah’s appointed term comes, it cannot be delayed, if you only knew!”
footnotes: [1] i.e., until the time your life comes to an end.

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُ قَوۡمِي لَيۡلٗا وَنَهَارٗا
translation: He said, “My Lord, I have surely called my people night and day,

arabic_text: فَلَمۡ يَزِدۡهُمۡ دُعَآءِيٓ إِلَّا فِرَارٗا
translation: but my call only drove them further away.

arabic_text: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ لِتَغۡفِرَ لَهُمۡ جَعَلُوٓاْ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِمۡ وَٱسۡتَغۡشَوۡاْ ثِيَابَهُمۡ وَأَصَرُّواْ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا
translation: Every time I call them so that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and cover their faces with their garments[2], and persist in obstinacy and grow extremely arrogant.
footnotes: [2] Refusing to see me or listen to my call.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوۡتُهُمۡ جِهَارٗا
translation: Then I called them openly,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَنتُ لَهُمۡ وَأَسۡرَرۡتُ لَهُمۡ إِسۡرَارٗا
translation: then I addressed them in public and in private,

arabic_text: فَقُلۡتُ ٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ رَبَّكُمۡ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفَّارٗا
translation: I said, ‘Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving.

arabic_text: يُرۡسِلِ ٱلسَّمَآءَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّدۡرَارٗا
translation: He will shower you with abundant rain from the sky,

arabic_text: وَيُمۡدِدۡكُم بِأَمۡوَٰلٖ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ أَنۡهَٰرٗا
translation: and He will give you wealth and children, and bestow upon you gardens and rivers.

arabic_text: مَّا لَكُمۡ لَا تَرۡجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارٗا
translation: What is the matter with you that you do not fear the Majesty of Allah[3],
footnotes: [3] While disobeying Him carelessly.

arabic_text: وَقَدۡ خَلَقَكُمۡ أَطۡوَارًا
translation: when He has created you in stages[4]?
footnotes: [4] See 22:5 and 23:12-14 for the stages of the embryo.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَوۡاْ كَيۡفَ خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ سَبۡعَ سَمَٰوَٰتٖ طِبَاقٗا
translation: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one above another,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورٗا وَجَعَلَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ سِرَاجٗا
translation: and has placed the moon therein as a light and the sun as a burning lamp?

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ أَنۢبَتَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ نَبَاتٗا
translation: Allah has produced you from the earth like a plant[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., your father Adam, whom Allah created from clay.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمۡ فِيهَا وَيُخۡرِجُكُمۡ إِخۡرَاجٗا
translation: then He will return you into it and then will bring you out again.

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِسَاطٗا
translation: Allah has made the earth widespread for you

arabic_text: لِّتَسۡلُكُواْ مِنۡهَا سُبُلٗا فِجَاجٗا
translation: so that you may tread its spacious paths[6].’”
footnotes: [6] In the pursuit of a lawful livelihood.

arabic_text: قَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ إِنَّهُمۡ عَصَوۡنِي وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَن لَّمۡ يَزِدۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَوَلَدُهُۥٓ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا
translation: Noah said, “My Lord, they have disobeyed me and followed those whose wealth and children did not increase them except in loss[7].
footnotes: [7] i.e., the lowly people among them followed their wealthy chiefs.

arabic_text: وَمَكَرُواْ مَكۡرٗا كُبَّارٗا
translation: They have contrived a mighty plot,

arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ لَا تَذَرُنَّ ءَالِهَتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدّٗا وَلَا سُوَاعٗا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسۡرٗا
translation: They said, ‘Do not abandon your gods; and do not abandon Wadd, Suwā‘, Yaghūth, Ya‘ūq, and Nasr[8].’
footnotes: [8] These were the names of idols named after pious men of past generations before the time of Noah, to commemorate them. In later generations, people started worshiping these idols.

arabic_text: وَقَدۡ أَضَلُّواْ كَثِيرٗاۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَٰلٗا
translation: They have led many astray. So [O Lord], do not increase the wrongdoers except in error.”

arabic_text: مِّمَّا خَطِيٓـَٰٔتِهِمۡ أُغۡرِقُواْ فَأُدۡخِلُواْ نَارٗا فَلَمۡ يَجِدُواْ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَنصَارٗا
translation: Because of their sins, they were drowned and then were cast into the Fire, and they did not find any helpers against Allah.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ نُوحٞ رَّبِّ لَا تَذَرۡ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
translation: Noah said, “My Lord, do not leave on earth a single disbeliever.

arabic_text: إِنَّكَ إِن تَذَرۡهُمۡ يُضِلُّواْ عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوٓاْ إِلَّا فَاجِرٗا كَفَّارٗا
translation: For if You leave them, they will surely lead Your slaves astray and beget none but wicked disbelievers.

arabic_text: رَّبِّ ٱغۡفِرۡ لِي وَلِوَٰلِدَيَّ وَلِمَن دَخَلَ بَيۡتِيَ مُؤۡمِنٗا وَلِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارَۢا
translation: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and all the believing men and women, and do not increase the wrongdoers except in ruin.”

arabic_text: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا
translation: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened [to the Qur’an,] and they said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation

arabic_text: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا
translation: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا
translation: And that He – our exalted and glorified Lord[1] – has neither taken a wife nor a child;
footnotes: [1] “Jadd” of Our Lord means His Glory, Grandeur, and Command.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
translation: and that the fool among us [i.e., Satan] used to say outrageous things about Allah[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., Satan tempted humans to believe that Allah has a wife and children, and that the angels are Allah's daughters.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا
translation: although we thought that humans and jinn would never tell lies about Allah.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا
translation: And there were some men who used to seek refuge with some jinn, but they only increased them in burden.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا
translation: They thought, just like you [jinn] thought that Allah would never send any messenger.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا
translation: We have sought to reach heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fire.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
translation: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but now anyone who eavesdrops will find a flaming fire waiting for him[3].
footnotes: [3] After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sent as a messenger, the jinn who used to eavesdrop on heaven and then pass it on to fortune-tellers came to an end.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا
translation: We do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends good for them.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
translation: Among us are some who are righteous and some who are otherwise, for we follow divergent ways[4].
footnotes: [4] In beliefs and religious duties.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا
translation: We have realized that we can never escape Allah on earth, nor can we ever escape Him by fleeing.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
translation: When we heard the guidance [of the Qur’an], we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will have no fear of curtailment [from his reward] or injustice[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., nor will the sins of another be placed upon him.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
translation: Among us are some who are Muslims and some who are deviant[6]. Those who accepted Islam have sought the true guidance,
footnotes: [6] i.e., deviant from the right way.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُواْ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبٗا
translation: but those who are deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’”

arabic_text: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا
translation: “If they had remained steadfast on the right way, We would have given them abundant rain,

arabic_text: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
translation: as a test for them[7]. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[8], He will make him suffer an arduous punishment.
footnotes:
[7] As to whether they will be grateful for Allah's provisions or not.
 [8] i.e., the Qur’an and obedience to Him.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
translation: The mosques[9] are for Allah alone, so do not supplicate anyone along with Allah.
footnotes: [9] "Masjid" here means every place of worship on earth.

arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
translation: Yet when the slave of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they swarmed around him[10].”
footnotes: [10] Crowding in the manner of locusts on top of one another in order to hear him (ﷺ). It refers to the jinn or to the Arabs pagans.

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا
translation: Say [O Prophet], “I only supplicate my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا
translation: Say, “I have no power to harm or benefit you[11].”
footnotes: [11] i.e., grant you goodness and guidance.

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا
translation: Say, “None can ever protect me from Allah [if I should disobey Him], nor can I ever find refuge except in Him.

arabic_text: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
translation: I only convey what I receive from Allah and His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever.

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا
translation: Until when they see what they were promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.

arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا
translation: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has appointed a distant time for it.

arabic_text: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
translation: [He is] the Knower of the unseen, He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
translation: except the messenger whom He chooses, then He appoints angel-guards before him and behind him[12]
footnotes: [12] Protecting him so that others do not know what he was informed of the unseen.

arabic_text: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
translation: to ensure[13] that the messengers fully conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge all about them, and keeps count of all things.”
footnotes: [13] Or "So He may make evident."

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ
translation: O you the enwrapped one[1],
footnotes: [1] Allah is addressing the Messenger (ﷺ), who was wrapped in his garments.

arabic_text: قُمِ ٱلَّيۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا
translation: Stand up in prayer at night except a little,

arabic_text: نِّصۡفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِيلًا
translation: half of it, or a little less,

arabic_text: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا
translation: or a little more, and recite the Qur’an at a measured pace.

arabic_text: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِي عَلَيۡكَ قَوۡلٗا ثَقِيلًا
translation: We will send down upon you a heavy Word[2].
footnotes: [2] i.e., the revelation, which the Prophet (ﷺ) would feel its great weight when descending upon him. Also, it is heavy for its ordinances, rulings, punishments, ethics, etc.

arabic_text: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
translation: Indeed, worship at night is more effective[3] and more conducive to proper recitation[4].
footnotes:
[3] Or "getting up at night is more difficult...," meaning that it can only be done by sincere believers.
 [4] i.e., for reciting, hearing, and understanding of the Qur’an.

arabic_text: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا
translation: In the daytime, you have plenty of time for your worldly matters.

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا
translation: And remember the Name of your Lord, and devote yourself completely to Him.

arabic_text: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
translation: [He is] Lord of the east and the west; none has the right to be worshiped except Him, so take Him as the Disposer of your affairs[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., trust in Allah and rely upon Him in all your matters.

arabic_text: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا
translation: Bear patiently what they say, and avoid them in a gracious manner.

arabic_text: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا
translation: Leave to Me the deniers who are having a life of luxury, and bear with them for a little while.

arabic_text: إِنَّ لَدَيۡنَآ أَنكَالٗا وَجَحِيمٗا
translation: Indeed, We have heavy shackles and a Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: وَطَعَامٗا ذَا غُصَّةٖ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمٗا
translation: and food that chokes, and a painful punishment,

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا
translation: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will convulse, and the mountains will be like dunes of loose sand.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا
translation: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger to be a witness over you, just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

arabic_text: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا
translation: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a severe punishment.

arabic_text: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا
translation: If you disbelieve, then how will you protect yourselves against a Day that will turn children’s hair gray?

arabic_text: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
translation: It will cause the sky to break asunder[6]. His promise will certainly be fulfilled.
footnotes: [6] Out of the terror of that Day.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
translation: Indeed, this is a reminder; so whoever wills may take a way to his Lord.

arabic_text: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
translation: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you[7]. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan[8]. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward[9]. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.
footnotes:
[7] The ruling mentioned at the beginning of this surah is lightened here. So from now on, the believers do not have to stick to any of the portions specified there; rather, they can pray whatever they can at night. It is out of the mercy of Allah upon His servants that He does not want hardship for them.
 [8] i.e., giving in charity and for His causes.
 [9] It will be rewarded tenfold, or 700-fold, and Allah gives even more to whoever He wills. See 2:261.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُدَّثِّرُ
translation: O you covered [in your cloak][1],
footnotes: [1] It refers to the Prophet (ﷺ).

arabic_text: قُمۡ فَأَنذِرۡ
translation: arise and warn,

arabic_text: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرۡ
translation: and proclaim the greatness of your Lord,

arabic_text: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرۡ
translation: and purify your garments,

arabic_text: وَٱلرُّجۡزَ فَٱهۡجُرۡ
translation: and shun idol worshiping[2],
footnotes: [2] And other sins and bad conducts and morals.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَمۡنُن تَسۡتَكۡثِرُ
translation: and do not do a favor for a greater return[3],
footnotes: [3] Or: do not consider your good deeds as a favor to Allah, thinking of your little deeds as abundant.

arabic_text: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصۡبِرۡ
translation: and be patient for the sake of your Lord.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي ٱلنَّاقُورِ
translation: When the Trumpet is sounded[4],
footnotes: [4] For the second time, causing all to rise from the dead for resurrection. See 39:68.

arabic_text: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَوۡمٌ عَسِيرٌ
translation: that Day will be a difficult day,

arabic_text: عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ غَيۡرُ يَسِيرٖ
translation: not easy for the disbelievers.

arabic_text: ذَرۡنِي وَمَنۡ خَلَقۡتُ وَحِيدٗا
translation: Leave me to deal with the one whom I created lonely[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., having no wealth or children. It refers to al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah, who was impressed by the Qur’an, yet he publicly denied it to win the approval of the pagans of Makkah.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡتُ لَهُۥ مَالٗا مَّمۡدُودٗا
translation: and gave him abundant wealth,

arabic_text: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودٗا
translation: and sons by his side,

arabic_text: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمۡهِيدٗا
translation: and gave him a life of comfort and power,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ يَطۡمَعُ أَنۡ أَزِيدَ
translation: yet he aspires that I should give him more.

arabic_text: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِأٓيَٰتِنَا عَنِيدٗا
translation: By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses.

arabic_text: سَأُرۡهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا
translation: I will subject him to an unbearable punishment.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
translation: For he reflected and plotted [against the Qur’an][6].
footnotes: [6] In order to discredit it.

arabic_text: فَقُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ
translation: May he perish, how he plotted!

arabic_text: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ
translation: Again, may he perish, how he plotted!

arabic_text: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
translation: Then he looked around,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
translation: then he frowned and scowled,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ
translation: then turned away with arrogance,

arabic_text: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ
translation: then said, “This is nothing but magic from the past.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ
translation: This is nothing but the words of a man.”

arabic_text: سَأُصۡلِيهِ سَقَرَ
translation: Soon I will make him burn in the Scorching Fire[7].
footnotes: [7] "Saqar" is one of the names of Hell.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ
translation: How do you know what Scorching Fire is?

arabic_text: لَا تُبۡقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ
translation: It leaves nothing and spares no one,

arabic_text: لَوَّاحَةٞ لِّلۡبَشَرِ
translation: scorching the skin.

arabic_text: عَلَيۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ
translation: It is overseen by nineteen [angels].

arabic_text: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ
translation: We have only appointed angels as keepers of the Fire, and We have only made their number as a test for the disbelievers[8], so that those who were given the Scripture may have certainty and the believers may increase in faith; and neither those who were given the Scripture nor the believers may have any doubts; and so that those [hypocrites] in whose hearts is sickness and the disbelievers may say, “What does Allah mean by this number?” Thus Allah causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills, and none knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. This is but a reminder to mankind.
footnotes: [8] To say what they want to say, so their punishment will be multiplied for them. Abu Jahl, one of the chief pagans in Makkah, made fun of the Prophet (ﷺ) when they came to know that the keepers of Hell are nineteen angels, so he ridiculed this number and said that it is an easy number to overcome.

arabic_text: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ
translation: No indeed! By the moon,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ
translation: and by the night when it departs,

arabic_text: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَآ أَسۡفَرَ
translation: and by the dawn when it brightens,

arabic_text: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ
translation: Hellfire is indeed one of the greatest matters,

arabic_text: نَذِيرٗا لِّلۡبَشَرِ
translation: a warning to mankind,

arabic_text: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ
translation: to whoever among you chooses to advance or regress.

arabic_text: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِينَةٌ
translation: Every soul is held in pledge[9] for its deeds,
footnotes: [9] i.e., held responsible.

arabic_text: إِلَّآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
translation: except the People of the Right[10],
footnotes: [10] i.e., the believers who receive their records of deeds in their right hands.

arabic_text: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
translation: who will be in gardens, asking one another

arabic_text: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ
translation: about the wicked:

arabic_text: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِي سَقَرَ
translation: “What brought you to Hell?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ
translation: They will say, “We were not among those who prayed,

arabic_text: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينَ
translation: nor did we feed the poor,

arabic_text: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَآئِضِينَ
translation: and we indulged in falsehood along with those who indulged in it,

arabic_text: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: and we denied the Day of Judgment,

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡيَقِينُ
translation: until the certainty [of death] came to us.”

arabic_text: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ
translation: So the intercession of intercessors will not benefit them.

arabic_text: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِينَ
translation: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from the Reminder,

arabic_text: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرٞ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةٞ
translation: as if they were terrified wild asses,

arabic_text: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ
translation: fleeing from a lion?

arabic_text: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
translation: In fact, each one of them desires that open [divine] letters be sent to each of them[11].
footnotes: [11] Instead of Muhammad (ﷺ), not due to the lack of proofs or signs presented to them but out of obstinacy and arrogance.

arabic_text: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ
translation: By no means! They rather do not fear the Hereafter.

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةٞ
translation: No indeed! This [Qur’an] is a reminder.

arabic_text: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
translation: So whoever wills may take heed.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ
translation: But they will not take heed unless Allah so wills. He is most worthy to be feared and most worthy to forgive.

arabic_text: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ
translation: I swear by the Day of Resurrection,

arabic_text: وَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
translation: and I swear by the self-reproaching soul[1]!
footnotes: [1] Of the believer, which blames oneself whenever falls into sin or error.

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ
translation: Does man think that We cannot reassemble his bones?

arabic_text: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ
translation: In fact, We are able to restore even his very fingertips.

arabic_text: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
translation: But man desires to persist in sin[2],
footnotes: [2] While denying the coming of the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ
translation: and asks [mockingly], “When is the Day of Resurrection?”

arabic_text: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ
translation: But when the sight is dazzled,

arabic_text: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
translation: and the moon is darkened,

arabic_text: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ
translation: and the sun and the moon are brought together[3],
footnotes: [3] They both have never been together since they were created. On this Day they will be brought together, darkened, and both will be thrown into the Hell; so that all should know that they were subservient created beings, especially those who worshiped them.

arabic_text: يَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذٍ أَيۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ
translation: on that Day man will say, “Where is the escape?”

arabic_text: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
translation: No indeed! There will be no refuge.

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ
translation: On that Day all will end up before your Lord.

arabic_text: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
translation: On that Day man will be informed of what he has sent forth[4] and left behind[5].
footnotes:
[4] i.e., of his deeds for the Hereafter.
 [5] i.e., that which he failed to do.

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٞ
translation: In fact, man will be a witness against himself[6],
footnotes: [6] His organs will testify against him, as mentioned in 36:65 and 41:20-23.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ
translation: despite the excuses he may put forward.

arabic_text: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
translation: Do not move your tongue [O Prophet] in haste trying to memorize it.

arabic_text: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ
translation: It is upon Us to make you memorize and recite it.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ
translation: Then when We recite it [through Gabriel], follow its recitation attentively;

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا بَيَانَهُۥ
translation: then it is upon Us to explain its meanings.

arabic_text: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ
translation: No indeed! You [people] love this fleeting world,

arabic_text: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ
translation: and neglect the Hereafter.

arabic_text: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاضِرَةٌ
translation: On that Day some faces will be bright,

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٞ
translation: looking at their Lord[7].
footnotes: [7] The dwellers of Paradise will be granted the honor of actually seeing their Lord in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بَاسِرَةٞ
translation: And on that Day, some faces will be gloomy,

arabic_text: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٞ
translation: knowing that a crushing calamity will befall them.

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِيَ
translation: Indeed, when the soul reaches the throat[8],
footnotes: [8] Upon death.

arabic_text: وَقِيلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقٖ
translation: and it is said, “Is there any healer?”

arabic_text: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ
translation: And he realizes that it is time to depart,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
translation: when legs are brought together [in a shroud][9];
footnotes: [9] The difficulties the person faces while leaving this world and moving on to the Hereafter; or the people arrange for the departure of his body, while angels arrange for the departure of his soul.

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ
translation: on that Day, he will be driven to your Lord.

arabic_text: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
translation: He neither believed nor prayed;

arabic_text: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation: rather he denied and turned away,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ
translation: then he went to his people, elated with pride,

arabic_text: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ
translation: Woe to you, and woe!

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰٓ
translation: Again, woe to you, and woe!

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتۡرَكَ سُدًى
translation: Does man think that he will be left neglected[10]?
footnotes: [10] i.e., without purpose and responsibility, or without returning to Allah for account.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ
translation: Was he not once a drop of semen emitted,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةٗ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
translation: then he became a clinging clot[11], then He created him and perfected his form,
footnotes: [11] "‘Alaqah": an embryo that resembles a leech.

arabic_text: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ
translation: and made from him both genders, male and female?

arabic_text: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ
translation: Is not He able to bring the dead back to life?

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا
translation: Was there not a period of time when man was not a thing [even] mentioned[1]?
footnotes: [1] Before coming into being.

arabic_text: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
translation: Indeed, We created man from a drop of mixed fluids[2], in order to test him. So We gave him hearing and sight.
footnotes: [2] A combination of male and female gametes (sperm and egg) which form the zygote after fertilization in the womb.

arabic_text: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
translation: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he is grateful or ungrateful.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا
translation: We have surely prepared for the disbelievers chains, shackles, and a Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
translation: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] flavored with camphor[3],
footnotes: [3] "Kāfoor": a sweet-scent spring in Paradise.

arabic_text: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا
translation: a spring from which Allah’s slaves will drink, which will flow as they wish.

arabic_text: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا
translation: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will spread far and wide,

arabic_text: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
translation: and they give food, despite their love for it[4], to the needy, the orphans, and the captives,
footnotes: [4] Or "out of love for Him (Allah)".

arabic_text: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا
translation: [saying to themselves] “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we seek from you neither reward nor gratitude.

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا
translation: We fear from our Lord a grim and distressful Day.”

arabic_text: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا
translation: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day, and will grant them radiance and delight,

arabic_text: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا
translation: and will reward them for their perseverance with Paradise and garments of silk.

arabic_text: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا
translation: They will recline therein on adorned couches; neither feeling scorching heat[5] nor freezing cold.
footnotes: [5] i.e., the sun.

arabic_text: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا
translation: with shady branches spread above them, and clusters of fruit will be made within their reach.

arabic_text: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠
translation: They will be served frequently with silver vessels and crystal cups,

arabic_text: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا
translation: crystalline goblets of silver, filled precisely as desired.

arabic_text: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
translation: They will be given a glass [of wine] flavored with ginger

arabic_text: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا
translation: from a spring therein called Salsabīl.

arabic_text: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا
translation: They will be served by eternal young boys; if you see them, you would think that they are scattered pearls.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا
translation: If you were to look around, you would see bliss and a vast dominion.

arabic_text: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا
translation: They will be dressed in garments of fine green silk and rich brocade, and will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا
translation: [And they will be told,] “Indeed, this is your reward, and your efforts have been appreciated.”

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا
translation: Indeed, it is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to you in stages.

arabic_text: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا
translation: So be patient with your Lord’s decree, and do not obey any sinner or disbeliever from among them.

arabic_text: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا
translation: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening[6],
footnotes: [6] This and the next verse refer to the five daily prayers: here it refers to the dawn prayer, then the noon and afternoon prayers.

arabic_text: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا
translation: and prostrate to Him at night, and glorify Him at length by night[7].
footnotes: [7] It refers to the sunset and night prayers.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا
translation: Indeed, these [pagans] love this fleeting life and pay no heed to a heavy Day ahead of them.

arabic_text: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا
translation: It is We Who created them and strengthened their build. If We will, We can replace them with others like them.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا
translation: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who wills may take a way to his Lord.

arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا
translation: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

arabic_text: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا
translation: He admits whom He wills into His mercy, but for the wrongdoers He has prepared a painful punishment.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَٰتِ عُرۡفٗا
translation: By those [winds] sent forth in succession,

arabic_text: فَٱلۡعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصۡفٗا
translation: those that blow violently,

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشۡرٗا
translation: and scatter [rainclouds] far and wide,

arabic_text: فَٱلۡفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرۡقٗا
translation: And by those [angels] who bring criterion[1];
footnotes: [1] To Allah's messengers to distinguish between truth and falsehood.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا
translation: and those who deliver revelation,

arabic_text: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا
translation: leaving no excuse or giving warning –

arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
translation: what you are promised will surely come to pass.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ
translation: So when the stars are effaced,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتۡ
translation: and when the sky is split apart,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ
translation: and when the mountains are blown away,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ
translation: and when the messengers are summoned[2],
footnotes: [2] To testify concerning their nations.

arabic_text: لِأَيِّ يَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ
translation: until which Day has all this been postponed?

arabic_text: لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ
translation: Until the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ
translation: How do you know what the Day of Judgment is?

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., Death and destruction be upon them.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: Did We not destroy the earlier nations?

arabic_text: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
translation: Then We will do likewise to the later ones.

arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ
translation: This is how We deal with the wicked.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٖ مَّهِينٖ
translation: Did We not create you from a worthless fluid,

arabic_text: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ فِي قَرَارٖ مَّكِينٍ
translation: then We placed it in a secure repository

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
translation: for a determined period[4]?

arabic_text: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَٰدِرُونَ
translation: For We determined it; How excellently We determine!

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا
translation: Have We not made the earth a receptacle[5]
footnotes: [5] i.e., a lodging, a container that contains all people.

arabic_text: أَحۡيَآءٗ وَأَمۡوَٰتٗا
translation: for the living and the dead,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا
translation: and placed therein firm towering mountains, and given you fresh water to drink?

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: [They will be told,] “Proceed to that [Fire] which you used to deny!

arabic_text: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ
translation: Proceed to the shadow [of smoke] ascending in three columns,

arabic_text: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
translation: that provides neither shade nor protection from the flames.

arabic_text: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِي بِشَرَرٖ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ
translation: Indeed, it [i.e., Hell] throws up sparks as big as castles,

arabic_text: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٞ صُفۡرٞ
translation: as if they were tawny camels[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., huge and black camels.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
translation: On that Day they won’t speak,

arabic_text: وَلَا يُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَيَعۡتَذِرُونَ
translation: nor will they be allowed to make excuses.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: [They will be told,] “This is the Day of Judgment: We have gathered you along with the earlier generations.

arabic_text: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَيۡدٞ فَكِيدُونِ
translation: So if you have any scheme, then plot it against Me.”

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَٰلٖ وَعُيُونٖ
translation: Indeed, the righteous will be amid shades and springs

arabic_text: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ
translation: and will have whatever fruit they desire.

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
translation: [They will be told,] “Eat and drink joyfully, as a reward for what you used to do.”

arabic_text: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ
translation: This is how We reward those who do good.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: كُلُواْ وَتَمَتَّعُواْ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ
translation: “Eat and enjoy yourselves for a while; you are truly wicked.”

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ
translation: When it is said to them, “Bow [in prayer],” they do not bow.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!

arabic_text: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ يُؤۡمِنُونَ
translation: In which message after this [Qur’an] will they believe?

arabic_text: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ
translation: About what are they asking one another?

arabic_text: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
translation: About the momentous news[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the Resurrection.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي هُمۡ فِيهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ
translation: that which they differ about[2].
footnotes: [2] The pagans of Makkah denied the Qur’an, resurrection, and judgment. They differed as to whether the Qur’an was magic, fortune-telling, or poetry.

arabic_text: كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: No indeed; they will come to know.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: Again no; they will come to know.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَٰدٗا
translation: Have We not made the earth a resting place?

arabic_text: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادٗا
translation: And the mountains as stakes[3],
footnotes: [3] Mountains go deep below the surface like pegs and icebergs, stabilizing the earth and slowing tectonic movement.

arabic_text: وَخَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا
translation: and created you in pairs,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتٗا
translation: and made your sleep for rest,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّيۡلَ لِبَاسٗا
translation: and made the night a covering[4],
footnotes: [4] Covering you in its darkness as garments cover you.

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشٗا
translation: and made the day for seeking a livelihood,

arabic_text: وَبَنَيۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعٗا شِدَادٗا
translation: and built above you seven mighty heavens,

arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجٗا وَهَّاجٗا
translation: and made therein a blazing lamp,

arabic_text: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَٰتِ مَآءٗ ثَجَّاجٗا
translation: and sent down from the rainclouds abundant water,

arabic_text: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبّٗا وَنَبَاتٗا
translation: so that We may produce thereby grains and vegetation,

arabic_text: وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا
translation: and gardens with dense foliage?

arabic_text: إِنَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتٗا
translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgment is a time appointed,

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجٗا
translation: the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, you will come forth in crowds,

arabic_text: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَٰبٗا
translation: and the sky will be opened up and will become gateways,

arabic_text: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا
translation: and the mountains will vanish, becoming like a mirage.

arabic_text: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادٗا
translation: Indeed, Hell is lying in wait,

arabic_text: لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابٗا
translation: a resort for the transgressors,

arabic_text: لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحۡقَابٗا
translation: wherein they will abide for endless ages.

arabic_text: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرۡدٗا وَلَا شَرَابًا
translation: They will neither taste therein any coolness nor any drink,

arabic_text: إِلَّا حَمِيمٗا وَغَسَّاقٗا
translation: except for scalding water and discharge of wounds,

arabic_text: جَزَآءٗ وِفَاقًا
translation: a fitting recompense[5].
footnotes: [5] To their disbelief and evil deeds.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ لَا يَرۡجُونَ حِسَابٗا
translation: Indeed, they did not expect a reckoning,

arabic_text: وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابٗا
translation: and utterly rejected Our verses.

arabic_text: وَكُلَّ شَيۡءٍ أَحۡصَيۡنَٰهُ كِتَٰبٗا
translation: But We have enumerated everything in a record[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., a record of deeds.

arabic_text: فَذُوقُواْ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
translation: So taste [the punishment], for We will not increase you except in torment[7].”
footnotes: [7] The addressees are the dwellers of Hell.

arabic_text: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
translation: Indeed, the righteous will have salvation[8],
footnotes: [8] i.e., safety from Hell and winning Paradise.

arabic_text: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعۡنَٰبٗا
translation: gardens and vineyards,

arabic_text: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابٗا
translation: and full-bosomed maidens of equal age,

arabic_text: وَكَأۡسٗا دِهَاقٗا
translation: and a full cup [of wine][9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., tasteful wine which neither intoxicates nor causes headache.

arabic_text: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا كِذَّٰبٗا
translation: They will not hear therein vain talk or lies –

arabic_text: جَزَآءٗ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابٗا
translation: a reward and a generous gift from your Lord[10],
footnotes: [10] Or "a gift adequately calculated"; as a result of their righteous deeds as well as the ample generosity of Allah.

arabic_text: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابٗا
translation: [from] the Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, the Most Compassionate; none will dare to speak to Him[11].
footnotes: [11] None can ask or plead on the Day of Judgment except by Allah's permission.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفّٗاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابٗا
translation: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows; none will dare to speak, except those to whom the Most Compassionate granted permission, and they will only speak the truth.

arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
translation: That Day is sure to come. So whoever wills may seek a path leading to his Lord[12].
footnotes: [12] i.e., the path of guidance and righteous deeds.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَنذَرۡنَٰكُمۡ عَذَابٗا قَرِيبٗا يَوۡمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَٰبَۢا
translation: Indeed, We have warned you of an imminent punishment on the Day when everyone will see what his hands have sent forth[13], and the disbeliever will say, “Oh, I wish that I were dust!”
footnotes: [13] i.e., the deeds he did in this world.

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرۡقٗا
translation: By those who pull out [evil souls][1] harshly,
footnotes: [1] Of the disbelievers.

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشۡطٗا
translation: and by those who draw out [good souls][2] gently,
footnotes: [2] Of the believers.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبۡحٗا
translation: and by those who glide swiftly[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., angels glide swiftly through the heavens and earth with Allah’s command.

arabic_text: فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبۡقٗا
translation: and those who overtake one another as in a race[4],
footnotes: [4] To execute Allah's commands.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمۡرٗا
translation: and those who carry out the command [of Allah],

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ
translation: on the Day when the earth convulses [by the first Blast],

arabic_text: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ
translation: followed by the second Blast,

arabic_text: قُلُوبٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاجِفَةٌ
translation: hearts[5] will be pounding on that Day,
footnotes: [5] Of those who denied the Resurrection.

arabic_text: أَبۡصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٞ
translation: and their eyes[6] will be downcast.
footnotes: [6] Of the disbelievers.

arabic_text: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِي ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ
translation: They say, “Will we be brought back to life,

arabic_text: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمٗا نَّخِرَةٗ
translation: after we have turned into decayed bones[7]?”
footnotes: [7] They would say this in ridicule of the warning.

arabic_text: قَالُواْ تِلۡكَ إِذٗا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٞ
translation: They say, “Then that would surely be a losing return[8]!”
footnotes: [8] To one another.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ
translation: It will only be a single Blast,

arabic_text: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ
translation: then they will immediately be above the ground.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ
translation: Has there come to you the story of Moses,

arabic_text: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
translation: when his Lord called out to him at the sacred valley of Tuwa?

arabic_text: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ
translation: [Saying,] “Go to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds”.

arabic_text: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ
translation: And say: ‘Are you willing to be purified,

arabic_text: وَأَهۡدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ
translation: and I will guide you to your Lord so that you may fear Him?’”

arabic_text: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡأٓيَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
translation: Then Moses showed him the greatest sign[9].
footnotes: [9] i.e., the miracle of the staff turning into a snake. See 20:17-23.

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
translation: But Pharaoh denied it and disobeyed.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ يَسۡعَىٰ
translation: Then he turned back striving to plot.

arabic_text: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
translation: He gathered [his people] and proclaimed,

arabic_text: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ
translation: saying, “I am your lord, the most high.”

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
translation: So Allah seized him for an exemplary punishment in this life and in the Hereafter[10].
footnotes: [10] Or for his claim of being the greatest god and for his previous oppression of the Children of Israel.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّمَن يَخۡشَىٰٓ
translation: Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who fear Allah.

arabic_text: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا
translation: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven that He built?

arabic_text: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا
translation: He raised its vault high and proportioned it,

arabic_text: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَيۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا
translation: and darkened its night and brought forth its daylight.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ
translation: And thereafter He spread out the earth,

arabic_text: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا
translation: brought forth from it its water and its pasture,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا
translation: and set the mountains firmly,

arabic_text: مَتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ
translation: as a provision for you and your grazing livestock.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
translation: But when the Supreme Calamity comes[11],
footnotes: [11] i.e., the second Blast which marks the Day of judgment.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ
translation: on that Day man will remember all what he did,

arabic_text: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ
translation: and the Blazing Fire will be exposed for all to see.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ
translation: As for those who transgressed,

arabic_text: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
translation: and preferred the life of this world,

arabic_text: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ
translation: the Blazing Fire will be their abode.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ
translation: But those who feared standing before their Lord and restrained themselves from evil desires,

arabic_text: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ
translation: Paradise will surely be their abode.

arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا
translation: They ask you concerning the Hour, “When will it be[12]?”
footnotes: [12] Lit., "established."

arabic_text: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَآ
translation: How could you possibly mention that?

arabic_text: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ
translation: Its knowledge rests only with your Lord[13].
footnotes: [13] i.e., its end and termination. Its ultimate knowledge belongs to Allah alone.

arabic_text: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰهَا
translation: You are only a warner for those who fear it.

arabic_text: كَأَنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا
translation: On the Day when they see it[14], it will be as if they had remained [in this world] no more than an evening or a morning.
footnotes: [14] i.e., the Hour.

arabic_text: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
translation: He frowned and turned away,

arabic_text: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ
translation: when the blind man came to him[1].
footnotes: [1] Abdullah ibn Um Maktūm, an early Muslim who was blind, came to the Prophet (ﷺ) seeking to learn, while the Prophet (ﷺ) was in the middle of a discussion with a leading pagan of Makkah, calling him to Islam. Abdullah was so impatient that he interrupted their discussion. The Prophet (ﷺ) frowned and turned his attention to that pagan. So this Makkan surah was revealed, telling the Prophet (ﷺ) that the faithful blind man was more worthy of attention than that disbeliever.

arabic_text: وَمَا يُدۡرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
translation: How would you know? Perhaps he might be purified[2],
footnotes: [2] Through the knowledge he learns from you.

arabic_text: أَوۡ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰٓ
translation: or he might take heed and benefit from the reminder?

arabic_text: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ
translation: But he who was indifferent[3],
footnotes: [3] Towards faith. Here it is referring to that influential pagan of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (ﷺ) had hoped to embrace Islam.

arabic_text: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ
translation: you give him your full attention,

arabic_text: وَمَا عَلَيۡكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
translation: although you are not to be blamed if he does not purify himself[4].
footnotes: [4] The Prophets are only responsible to convey the message, not for people’s guidance.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسۡعَىٰ
translation: But as for the one who came to you striving [for purification],

arabic_text: وَهُوَ يَخۡشَىٰ
translation: and he fears Allah,

arabic_text: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
translation: you let yourself be distracted from him.

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةٞ
translation: No indeed; this is a reminder –

arabic_text: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
translation: so whoever wills may give heed to it –

arabic_text: فِي صُحُفٖ مُّكَرَّمَةٖ
translation: on venerable pages,

arabic_text: مَّرۡفُوعَةٖ مُّطَهَّرَةِۭ
translation: exalted and purified,

arabic_text: بِأَيۡدِي سَفَرَةٖ
translation: [preserved] in the hands of angel-scribes,

arabic_text: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةٖ
translation: honorable and obedient.

arabic_text: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ
translation: Woe to man; how ungrateful he is[5]!
footnotes: [5] i.e., the disbelievers.

arabic_text: مِنۡ أَيِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ
translation: From what did He create him?

arabic_text: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ
translation: He created him from a drop of semen and proportioned him[6],
footnotes: [6] His creation, provisions, life span, etc.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ
translation: then He made the way easy for him[7];
footnotes: [7] i.e., the way out of his mothers’ wombs (his birth), or the way to guidance.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ
translation: then He caused him to die and be buried;

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ
translation: then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

arabic_text: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقۡضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ
translation: Yet he has not fulfilled what He commanded him.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ
translation: Let man consider the food he eats:

arabic_text: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَآءَ صَبّٗا
translation: How We pour down rainwater in torrents,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقّٗا
translation: and cause the soil to split open [for sprouts],

arabic_text: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا حَبّٗا
translation: and cause grains to grow in it,

arabic_text: وَعِنَبٗا وَقَضۡبٗا
translation: as well as grapes and fodder,

arabic_text: وَزَيۡتُونٗا وَنَخۡلٗا
translation: and olive trees and date palms,

arabic_text: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلۡبٗا
translation: and dense orchards,

arabic_text: وَفَٰكِهَةٗ وَأَبّٗا
translation: and fruits and grass,

arabic_text: مَّتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ
translation: as provision for you and your livestock.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
translation: But when the Deafening Blast[8] comes,
footnotes: [8] The piercing Blast; the second Blast for resurrection.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِيهِ
translation: on that Day everyone will flee from his brother,

arabic_text: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ
translation: and from his mother and father,

arabic_text: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ
translation: and from his wife and children.

arabic_text: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ شَأۡنٞ يُغۡنِيهِ
translation: On that day, everyone will have enough concern of his own[9].
footnotes: [9] Thus forgetting all others.

arabic_text: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ مُّسۡفِرَةٞ
translation: On that Day, some faces will be bright,

arabic_text: ضَاحِكَةٞ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةٞ
translation: cheerful and rejoicing;

arabic_text: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَلَيۡهَا غَبَرَةٞ
translation: while other faces will be dust-stained,

arabic_text: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
translation: covered in darkness.

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ
translation: Such are the disbelievers, the wicked.

arabic_text: إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ
translation: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ
translation: and when the stars fall down,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتۡ
translation: and when the mountains are set in motion,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ
translation: and when pregnant camels[1] are left unattended,
footnotes: [1] Which are near delivery. It alludes to the distraction of people from their most valuable possessions, such as ten-month pregnant camels for nomadic Arabs.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ
translation: and when wild beasts are gathered,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ
translation: and when the seas are set on fire,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ
translation: and when the souls are sorted[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., "joined" with their groups or sects, wicked with the wicked souls, righteous with the righteous.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتۡ
translation: and when the baby girl buried alive[3] is asked,
footnotes: [3] As the pagan Arabs used to do for fear of shame or poverty. The Qur’an condemned this practice. See 16:58-59.

arabic_text: بِأَيِّ ذَنۢبٖ قُتِلَتۡ
translation: for what crime she was killed,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ
translation: and when records of deeds are spread open,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتۡ
translation: and when the sky is stripped away[4],
footnotes: [4] As the skin of sheep is stripped away.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتۡ
translation: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ
translation: and when Paradise is brought near –

arabic_text: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّآ أَحۡضَرَتۡ
translation: then every soul will know what it has brought about[5].
footnotes: [5] Of faith or disbelief, good or bad deeds for that Day.

arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ
translation: I swear by the receding stars,

arabic_text: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ
translation: that rise and hide[6],
footnotes: [6] This probably refers to black holes in the sky. "Kanasa" means sweeping or hiding.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ
translation: and by the night as it departs,

arabic_text: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
translation: and by the day as it breaks –

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ
translation: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.

arabic_text: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ
translation: extremely powerful, highly revered by the Lord of the Throne,

arabic_text: مُّطَاعٖ ثَمَّ أَمِينٖ
translation: obeyed there [by other angels] and trustworthy.

arabic_text: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونٖ
translation: Your fellow [i.e., the Prophet] is not a madman.

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ
translation: He indeed saw him [i.e., Gabriel] on the clear horizon[7].
footnotes: [7] i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote 53:6

arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَيۡبِ بِضَنِينٖ
translation: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen[8].
footnotes: [8] He (ﷺ) did not withhold the unseen which Allah had revealed to him in the Qur’an.

arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٖ
translation: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.

arabic_text: فَأَيۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ
translation: So which way are you going[9]?
footnotes: [9] In your denial of the Qur’an for being the revelation from Allah.

arabic_text: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: It is but a reminder to the worlds,

arabic_text: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَسۡتَقِيمَ
translation: for those among you who wish to take the straight path.

arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

arabic_text: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ
translation: When the sky breaks apart.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ
translation: and when the stars fall, scattered,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ
translation: and when the seas burst forth,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ
translation: and when the graves are overturned,

arabic_text: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ
translation: then each soul will come to know what it has done or what it has left undone.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِيمِ
translation: O mankind, what has lured you away from your Lord, the Most Generous,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
translation: Who created you, then shaped and proportioned you,

arabic_text: فِيٓ أَيِّ صُورَةٖ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
translation: and assembled you in whatever form He willed?

arabic_text: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ
translation: No indeed; but you deny the Judgment Day,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكُمۡ لَحَٰفِظِينَ
translation: while there are watchers[1] over you,
footnotes: [1] i.e., angels who preserve all your deeds.

arabic_text: كِرَامٗا كَٰتِبِينَ
translation: honorable scribes,

arabic_text: يَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ
translation: who know whatever you do.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٖ
translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٖ
translation: and the wicked will be in Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: which they will enter on Judgment Day,
