arabic_text: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ
translation: and will never come out of it.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: How do you know what Judgment Day is?

arabic_text: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: Again, how do you know what Judgment Day is?

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسٞ لِّنَفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلَّهِ
translation: It is the Day when no soul will be of any help to another, and all command on that Day will be with Allah.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِينَ
translation: Woe to the defrauders[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., those who cheat people by giving them less in sale transactions, an amount so little as to hardly be noticed.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُواْ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسۡتَوۡفُونَ
translation: those who take full measure when they take from others,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ يُخۡسِرُونَ
translation: but they give less when they measure or weigh for them.

arabic_text: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ
translation: Do they really not think that they will be resurrected

arabic_text: لِيَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
translation: for a momentous Day,

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
translation: a Day when people will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٖ
translation: No indeed! The record of the wicked is surely in Sijjīn.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٞ
translation: How do you know what Sijjīn is?

arabic_text: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ
translation: It is a clearly inscribed Record.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
translation: those who deny the Judgment Day!

arabic_text: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
translation: None denies it except every sinful transgressor.

arabic_text: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
translation: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “Ancient fables[2]!”
footnotes: [2] i.e., tales of old times, legends of former peoples.

arabic_text: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ
translation: No indeed! Their hearts have been stained by what they used to commit[3]!
footnotes: [3] i.e., their sins and evil deeds.

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ
translation: No indeed! On that Day they will be barred from seeing their Lord[4].
footnotes: [4] As a punishment, since the believers will see Him.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُواْ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
translation: They will then surely enter the Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: then they will be told, “This is what you used to deny.”

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
translation: No indeed! The record of the righteous is certainly in ‘illiyyīn –

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
translation: and how do you know what ‘illiyyūn is? –

arabic_text: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ
translation: It is a record inscribed,

arabic_text: يَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation: witnessed by those who are close to Allah.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in Bliss,

arabic_text: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
translation: seated on the couches, gazing in wonder.

arabic_text: تَعۡرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
translation: You will see on their faces the radiance of bliss.

arabic_text: يُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِيقٖ مَّخۡتُومٍ
translation: They will be served to drink pure wine from a sealed container,

arabic_text: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكٞۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلۡيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ
translation: whose last sip is musk[5] – let those who strive, strive for that –
footnotes: [5] i.e., having a lingering odor.

arabic_text: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِيمٍ
translation: and it will be mixed with water from the spring of Tasnīm[6],
footnotes: [6] It is the highest spring in Paradise.

arabic_text: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ
translation: a spring from which those who are close to Allah will drink.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجۡرَمُواْ كَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ يَضۡحَكُونَ
translation: Indeed, the wicked used to laugh at the believers;

arabic_text: وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِهِمۡ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
translation: when they passed by them, they would wink at one another,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُواْ فَكِهِينَ
translation: and when they went back to their people, they would return exulting.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
translation: When they saw the believers, they would say, “These people are truly misguided,”

arabic_text: وَمَآ أُرۡسِلُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَٰفِظِينَ
translation: although they were not sent as their keepers.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ يَضۡحَكُونَ
translation: So Today[7] the believers will laugh at the disbelievers,
footnotes: [7] i.e., the Day of Judgment.

arabic_text: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ
translation: while sitting on the couches, gazing around.

arabic_text: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ
translation: Have the disbelievers been rewarded except for what they used to do?

arabic_text: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ
translation: When the sky is rent asunder,

arabic_text: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ
translation: and hearkens to its Lord[1], as it must,
footnotes: [1] In full obedience.

arabic_text: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ
translation: and when the earth is leveled out[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., spread out.

arabic_text: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ
translation: and casts out all what it contains[3], and becomes empty,
footnotes: [3] i.e., its dead bodies and treasures buried in it.

arabic_text: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ
translation: and hearkens to its Lord, as it must,

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
translation: O humans, you are toiling towards your Lord[4], and you will surely meet Him[5].
footnotes:
[4] i.e., striving in doing good or evil until you meet your Lord.
 [5] To be recompensed by Him for your deeds.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ
translation: Whoever is given his Record in his right hand,

arabic_text: فَسَوۡفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابٗا يَسِيرٗا
translation: he will have an easy reckoning,

arabic_text: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورٗا
translation: and he will return to his people joyfully.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ
translation: But whoever is given his Record from behind his back,

arabic_text: فَسَوۡفَ يَدۡعُواْ ثُبُورٗا
translation: he will call out for destruction,

arabic_text: وَيَصۡلَىٰ سَعِيرًا
translation: and he will enter the Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِيٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا
translation: Indeed, he used to live among his people joyfully.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ
translation: and he thought that he would never return [to Allah].

arabic_text: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا
translation: Indeed he will! His Lord was always watching him.

arabic_text: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ
translation: Indeed, I swear by the twilight,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
translation: and by the night and what it covers,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ
translation: and by the moon when it becomes full,

arabic_text: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٖ
translation: You will surely pass from one stage to another[6].
footnotes: [6] i.e., from sperm-drop to clinging clot to lump, from life to death to resurrection.

arabic_text: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
translation: Then what is the matter with them that they do not believe,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩
translation: and when the Qur’an is recited to them, they do not prostrate?

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يُكَذِّبُونَ
translation: Rather, the disbelievers persist in denying it,

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
translation: but Allah knows best whatever they harbor in their hearts.

arabic_text: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
translation: So give them the tidings of a painful punishment.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ
translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds will have a never-ending reward.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ
translation: By the sky full of constellations,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ
translation: and by the promised Day,

arabic_text: وَشَاهِدٖ وَمَشۡهُودٖ
translation: and by the witness and the witnessed,

arabic_text: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ
translation: cursed be the makers of the trench[1],
footnotes: [1] Those who worked for a tyrannical king and did not allow the people to believe in Allah. Their blind obedience to their ruler incurred upon them the curse of Allah.

arabic_text: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ
translation: the fire full of fuel,

arabic_text: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا قُعُودٞ
translation: when they sat around it,

arabic_text: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ شُهُودٞ
translation: and were witnessing what they did to the believers[2].
footnotes: [2] After the believers were casted into a trench of fire, they sat around it watching them burn to death. It occurred long before Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) time.

arabic_text: وَمَا نَقَمُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَمِيدِ
translation: Their only grievance against them was that they believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the Praiseworthy,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٌ
translation: to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and earth, and Allah is Witness over all things.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُواْ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ يَتُوبُواْ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِيقِ
translation: Indeed, for those who tortured the believing men and women, and then did not repent, there will be the punishment of Hell and the punishment of the burning fire[3].
footnotes: [3] Those who burned the believers will be punished with the burning fire in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِيرُ
translation: But those who believed and did righteous deeds will certainly have gardens under which rivers flow; that is the supreme triumph.

arabic_text: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
translation: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is severe.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبۡدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ
translation: Indeed, it is He Who originates [the creation] and then resurrects all,

arabic_text: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ
translation: and He is the All-Forgiving, the Most Affectionate,

arabic_text: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِيدُ
translation: the Lord of the Glorious Throne;

arabic_text: فَعَّالٞ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
translation: He does whatever He wills.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ
translation: Has there not come to you the story of the forces

arabic_text: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ
translation: of Pharaoh and Thamūd?

arabic_text: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي تَكۡذِيبٖ
translation: But the disbelievers are in persistent denial,

arabic_text: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطُۢ
translation: although Allah encompasses them from all sides.

arabic_text: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانٞ مَّجِيدٞ
translation: But this is a glorious Qur’an,

arabic_text: فِي لَوۡحٖ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ
translation: [inscribed] in a Preserved Tablet.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ
translation: By the sky and the night comer –

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ
translation: and how do you know what the night comer is?

arabic_text: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
translation: It is the star of piercing brightness[1] –
footnotes: [1] Whose light pierces through the darkness or through the sky.

arabic_text: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ
translation: there is no soul except that there is a watcher over it.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
translation: Let man reflect on what he was created from.

arabic_text: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٖ دَافِقٖ
translation: He was created from a spurting fluid,

arabic_text: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ
translation: emerging from between the backbone and the ribs[2].
footnotes: [2] Both testes and ovaries are sustained by arteries originating between the backbone and the ribcage.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٞ
translation: Indeed, Allah is able to bring him back to life.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
translation: On the Day when all secrets will be disclosed[3],
footnotes: [3] The secrets will be examined, disclosing the real intentions and faiths people harbored, distinguishing between righteous and evil therefrom.

arabic_text: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ
translation: he will then have no power, nor any helper.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ
translation: By the sky and its recurring rain[4],
footnotes: [4] And sun, moon, stars, clouds, heat, etc.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ
translation: and by the earth that cracks open [with the sprout of plants],

arabic_text: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلٞ فَصۡلٞ
translation: Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a decisive word,

arabic_text: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ
translation: which is not for amusement.

arabic_text: إِنَّهُمۡ يَكِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗا
translation: Indeed, they are devising a plan.

arabic_text: وَأَكِيدُ كَيۡدٗا
translation: I am too devising a plan.

arabic_text: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَيۡدَۢا
translation: So bear with the disbelievers, and give them respite for a while[5].
footnotes: [5] i.e., Do not be in haste in seeking their punishment and destruction.

arabic_text: سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى
translation: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
translation: Who created and fashioned in due proportion,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
translation: and Who determined [the creation] then inspired them,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ
translation: and Who brings forth the pasture,

arabic_text: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحۡوَىٰ
translation: then makes it into withered chaff.

arabic_text: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ
translation: We will teach you [the Qur’an], so you will not forget,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا يَخۡفَىٰ
translation: except what Allah wills[1], for indeed He knows what is manifest and what is hidden.
footnotes: [1] i.e., except what Allah wills to make you forget for wisdom such as abrogating or replacing a ruling by another.

arabic_text: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ
translation: We will guide you to the easy way[2].
footnotes: [2] To the way of Islam which brings about ease in this life and attainment of Paradise in the Hereafter, or will give you opportunities for righteous deeds that lead to Paradise.

arabic_text: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
translation: So remind, if the reminder should benefit[3].
footnotes: [3] Wherever this Qur’an will be heard.

arabic_text: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰ
translation: He who fears Allah will take heed,

arabic_text: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى
translation: but the wretched will avoid it,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي يَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
translation: who will enter the Great Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحۡيَىٰ
translation: wherein he will neither die nor live.

arabic_text: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ
translation: Indeed, he who purifies himself will attain success,

arabic_text: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ
translation: and remembers his Lord’s Name and prays.

arabic_text: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
translation: But you prefer the life of this world,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ وَأَبۡقَىٰٓ
translation: even though the Hereafter is better and more lasting.

arabic_text: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ
translation: Indeed, this was in the earlier Scriptures,

arabic_text: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
translation: the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡغَٰشِيَةِ
translation: Has there come to you the story of the Overwhelming Event?

arabic_text: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ خَٰشِعَةٌ
translation: On that Day, some faces will be humiliated,

arabic_text: عَامِلَةٞ نَّاصِبَةٞ
translation: overburdened and weary[1],
footnotes: [1] They will be burdened with the heavy shackles in the Hereafter, or they performed deeds in their worldly life which were bereft of faith or not done for the sake of Allah.

arabic_text: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةٗ
translation: as they burn in a scorching Fire.

arabic_text: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَيۡنٍ ءَانِيَةٖ
translation: They will be made to drink from a boiling spring,

arabic_text: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ
translation: and they will have no food except bitter thorny plants,

arabic_text: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ
translation: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.

arabic_text: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاعِمَةٞ
translation: Other faces on that Day will be joyful,

arabic_text: لِّسَعۡيِهَا رَاضِيَةٞ
translation: well-pleased with their past striving,

arabic_text: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ
translation: in an elevated garden,

arabic_text: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِيهَا لَٰغِيَةٗ
translation: wherein no idle talk will be heard[2].
footnotes: [2] Rather than an insult, falsehood, immorality, etc.

arabic_text: فِيهَا عَيۡنٞ جَارِيَةٞ
translation: There will be a flowing spring;

arabic_text: فِيهَا سُرُرٞ مَّرۡفُوعَةٞ
translation: and couches raised high,

arabic_text: وَأَكۡوَابٞ مَّوۡضُوعَةٞ
translation: and cups placed ready,

arabic_text: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةٞ
translation: and cushions lined up,

arabic_text: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ
translation: and splendid carpets spread out.

arabic_text: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ
translation: Do they not reflect on the camel, how it is created;

arabic_text: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ
translation: and the sky, how it is raised high;

arabic_text: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَيۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ
translation: and the mountains, how they are firmly set up;

arabic_text: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَيۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ
translation: and the earth, how it is spread out?

arabic_text: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٞ
translation: So remind [O Prophet]; your duty is only to remind;

arabic_text: لَّسۡتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِمُصَيۡطِرٍ
translation: you are not assigned to compel them.

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
translation: But whoever turns away and disbelieves,

arabic_text: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ
translation: Allah will inflict upon him the greatest punishment[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., the greatest punishment is the Hellfire. The minor punishment includes disasters in worldly life and grave punishment.

arabic_text: إِنَّ إِلَيۡنَآ إِيَابَهُمۡ
translation: Indeed, to Us is their return,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا حِسَابَهُم
translation: then it is for Us to call them to account.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ
translation: By the dawn,

arabic_text: وَلَيَالٍ عَشۡرٖ
translation: and the ten nights[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the first ten nights of the lunar month of Dhul-Hijjah.

arabic_text: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ
translation: and the even and the odd[2],
footnotes: [2] Of the things.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَسۡرِ
translation: and by the night when it comes,

arabic_text: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ
translation: are these oaths not sufficient for those who have sense?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
translation: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād

arabic_text: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ
translation: of Iram[3], who were people of great stature,
footnotes: [3] Iram: an ancient tribe; or a well-known tribe in Yemen; or the grandfather of the people of ‘Aad, etc. Prophet Hūd was sent to the people of ‘Aad.

arabic_text: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ
translation: the like of whom had never been created in the land;

arabic_text: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُواْ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ
translation: and Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the Valley;

arabic_text: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِي ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
translation: and the mighty and powerful[4] Pharaoh?
footnotes: [4] Or the owner of the stakes by which he used to torture people.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ
translation: All of them transgressed in the land,

arabic_text: فَأَكۡثَرُواْ فِيهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ
translation: and spread therein much corruption,

arabic_text: فَصَبَّ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ
translation: so your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.

arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ
translation: Indeed, your Lord is ever vigilant.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
translation: As for man, when he is tested by his Lord by honoring him and bestowing blessings upon him, he says, “My Lord has [deservedly] honored me[5]!”
footnotes: [5] Instead of being grateful, he is proud, attributing the favor to his own merit.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
translation: But when he is tested by restricting his provision, he says, “My Lord has [undeservedly] humiliated me!”

arabic_text: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ
translation: No indeed[6]! You are not kind to the orphan,
footnotes: [6] It is not as you think. Allah puts people to test through prosperity and hardship and rewards their gratitude and patience in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَحَٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ
translation: nor do you urge one another to feed the needy,

arabic_text: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلٗا لَّمّٗا
translation: and you greedily consume the entire inheritance[7],
footnotes: [7] Whether lawful or unlawful.

arabic_text: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبّٗا جَمّٗا
translation: and love wealth immensely.

arabic_text: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا
translation: No indeed! When the earth is crushed over and over,

arabic_text: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفّٗا صَفّٗا
translation: and your Lord comes[8] with the angels, rank after rank,
footnotes: [8] To pass judgment between people.

arabic_text: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
translation: and Hell is brought near on that Day – this is when man will understand, but what is the use of that understanding?

arabic_text: يَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَيَاتِي
translation: He will say, “Would that I had sent forth something for my [eternal] life!”

arabic_text: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ
translation: None can punish as He punishes on that Day,

arabic_text: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ
translation: and none can bind as He binds.

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَئِنَّةُ
translation: [It will be said to the believer,] “O the tranquil soul!

arabic_text: ٱرۡجِعِيٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةٗ مَّرۡضِيَّةٗ
translation: Return to your Lord, well pleased and pleasing [to Him].

arabic_text: فَٱدۡخُلِي فِي عِبَٰدِي
translation: Join My [righteous] slaves,

arabic_text: وَٱدۡخُلِي جَنَّتِي
translation: and enter My Paradise.”

arabic_text: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ
translation: I do swear by this city [of Makkah] –

arabic_text: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ
translation: and you are free of restriction [for a while] in this city[1] –
footnotes: [1] To punish the enemies of Islam on the Conquest Day.

arabic_text: وَوَالِدٖ وَمَا وَلَدَ
translation: and by every parent[2] and his offspring,
footnotes: [2] i.e., Adam.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِي كَبَدٍ
translation: We have created man in hardship.

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ أَحَدٞ
translation: Does he think that none can ever have power over him?

arabic_text: يَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالٗا لُّبَدًا
translation: He says, “I have squandered enormous wealth!”

arabic_text: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ
translation: Does he think that no one sees him?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَيۡنَيۡنِ
translation: Have We not given him two eyes,

arabic_text: وَلِسَانٗا وَشَفَتَيۡنِ
translation: and a tongue and two lips,

arabic_text: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَيۡنِ
translation: and shown him the two ways [of right and wrong]?

arabic_text: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ
translation: Yet he did not make his way through the steep path[3],
footnotes: [3] He did not spend for the sake of Allah but to show off.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ
translation: and how do you know what the steep path is?

arabic_text: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
translation: It is freeing a slave,

arabic_text: أَوۡ إِطۡعَٰمٞ فِي يَوۡمٖ ذِي مَسۡغَبَةٖ
translation: or giving food on a day of hunger,

arabic_text: يَتِيمٗا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ
translation: to an orphan relative,

arabic_text: أَوۡ مِسۡكِينٗا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةٖ
translation: or to a needy person in misery,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ
translation: then [most importantly] to be one of those who believe and exhort one another to patience and exhort one another to compassion.

arabic_text: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
translation: Such are the people of the Right[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the right hand and proceed to Paradise.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
translation: As for those who reject Our signs, they are the people of the Left[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., those who receive the records of their deeds in the left hand and proceed to Hellfire.

arabic_text: عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَارٞ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ
translation: who will be locked up in the Fire.

arabic_text: وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا
translation: By the sun and its brightness,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا
translation: and by the moon as it follows it[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., appears after the sun disappears.

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
translation: and by the day as it displays it[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., the earth or the sun.

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰهَا
translation: and by the night as it covers it[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., the earth or the sun.

arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا
translation: and by the sky and how He made it,

arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا
translation: and by the earth and how He spread it,

arabic_text: وَنَفۡسٖ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
translation: and by the soul and how He fashioned it[4],
footnotes: [4] By sound natural disposition.

arabic_text: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا
translation: then inspired it [to know] its wickedness and righteousness,

arabic_text: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا
translation: Indeed, he who purifies his soul will attain success,

arabic_text: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا
translation: and he who corrupts it will be doomed.

arabic_text: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَآ
translation: Thamūd rejected [the messenger] because of their transgression,

arabic_text: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا
translation: when the most wretched among them rose[5].
footnotes: [5] To kill the camel that Allah sent as a miracle to them.

arabic_text: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا
translation: Although the messenger of Allah warned them, “Hands off the she-camel of Allah and her drink!”

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
translation: Yet they rejected him and hamstrung her[6]. So their Lord destroyed them for their sin and leveled them to the ground.
footnotes: [6] And then killed her.

arabic_text: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقۡبَٰهَا
translation: And He has no fear of the consequences thereof[7].
footnotes: [7] Allah is not asked for what He does, but His slaves will be asked. See 21:23

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰ
translation: By the night when it covers[1],
footnotes: [1] Everything between sky and earth with its darkness.

arabic_text: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
translation: and by the day when it appears,

arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ
translation: and by His creation of male and female,

arabic_text: إِنَّ سَعۡيَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ
translation: surely your efforts are divergent.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ
translation: As for the one who gives in charity and fears Allah,

arabic_text: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ
translation: and truly believes in the best reward,

arabic_text: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ
translation: We will make easy for him the way of salvation.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ
translation: But as for the one who is miserly and deems himself self-sufficient,

arabic_text: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ
translation: and denies the best reward,

arabic_text: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ
translation: We will make easy for him the way of perdition.

arabic_text: وَمَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
translation: His wealth will be of no avail to him when he tumbles [into Hell].

arabic_text: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ
translation: Indeed, it is upon Us to show the right way,

arabic_text: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡأٓخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ
translation: and surely to Us belong the Hereafter and the present life.

arabic_text: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارٗا تَلَظَّىٰ
translation: So I warn you of a raging Fire,

arabic_text: لَا يَصۡلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى
translation: none will enter it except the most wretched,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
translation: who denied and turned away.

arabic_text: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى
translation: But the most righteous will be saved from it,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي يُؤۡتِي مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
translation: who spends his wealth to purify himself,

arabic_text: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةٖ تُجۡزَىٰٓ
translation: not in return for someone’s favors[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., not as a repayment for a favor he received.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ
translation: but to seek the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High.

arabic_text: وَلَسَوۡفَ يَرۡضَىٰ
translation: He will surely be well pleased.

arabic_text: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ
translation: By the morning sunlight,

arabic_text: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
translation: and by the night when it covers with darkness[1],
footnotes: [1] And everything becomes still.

arabic_text: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
translation: your Lord has neither forsaken you [O Prophet] nor hated you;

arabic_text: وَلَلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ
translation: the Hereafter is better for you than the present life;

arabic_text: وَلَسَوۡفَ يُعۡطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرۡضَىٰٓ
translation: and your Lord will certainly give you so much that you will be well pleased.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَجِدۡكَ يَتِيمٗا فَـَٔاوَىٰ
translation: Did He not find you an orphan then take good care of you?

arabic_text: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلّٗا فَهَدَىٰ
translation: Did He not find you unguided then guide you?

arabic_text: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلٗا فَأَغۡنَىٰ
translation: Did He not find you in need then enrich you?

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقۡهَرۡ
translation: So do not mistreat the orphan,

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنۡهَرۡ
translation: nor repulse the beggar[2];
footnotes: [2] i.e., anyone in need who seeks help.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا بِنِعۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثۡ
translation: and proclaim the favors of your Lord[3].
footnotes: [3] i.e., be grateful to Allah by proclaiming the favors He has given you.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ نَشۡرَحۡ لَكَ صَدۡرَكَ
translation: Have We not reassured your heart for you [O Prophet][1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., enlighten and gladden your heart for receiving the revelation.

arabic_text: وَوَضَعۡنَا عَنكَ وِزۡرَكَ
translation: and relieved you of your burden[2]
footnotes: [2] forgave your previous or future errors, or relieved you of the anxiety you experienced at the beginning of your mission.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهۡرَكَ
translation: that weighed down your back,

arabic_text: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ
translation: and raised high your fame for you[3]?
footnotes: [3] Allah raised the Prophet's name in numerous ways, such as his name is mentioned twice in the call to prayer five times a day, as well the second call to prayer; at the end of each of the five daily prayers; believers invoke Allah’s blessings upon him and his family; and upon reverting to Islam, his name is mentioned, etc.

arabic_text: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرًا
translation: For indeed, with hardship comes ease[4],
footnotes: [4] In Arabic grammar, if a definite noun is repeated, it is referring to the same thing. However, if an indefinite noun is repeated, it is referring to two different things. So here in this and the coming verse they refer to one hardship (a definite noun) and two eases (an indefinite noun), which manifests Allah's favors upon His servants even in times of hardships.

arabic_text: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرٗا
translation: indeed, with hardship comes ease.

arabic_text: فَإِذَا فَرَغۡتَ فَٱنصَبۡ
translation: So whenever you are free[5], strive in worship,
footnotes: [5] Of your duties.

arabic_text: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرۡغَب
translation: and turn to your Lord in devotion.

arabic_text: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيۡتُونِ
translation: By the fig and the olive[1],
footnotes: [1] Of Jerusalem.

arabic_text: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
translation: and by Mount Sinai[2],
footnotes: [2] Of Egypt.

arabic_text: وَهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ٱلۡأَمِينِ
translation: and by this secure city [of Makkah][3],
footnotes: [3] This passage refers to the land of the three great prophets of Allah: Jesus (ﷺ) lived in the land of figs and olives, Moses (ﷺ) communicated with Allah on Mount Sinai, and Muhammad's (ﷺ) birthplace was Makkah. There is a similar reference in Deuteronomy 33:1, [Moses said:] “The Lord came from Sinai. Rising from Seir upon us, and he shone forth from Mount Paran.” Seir is a mountain near Jerusalem, and Paran is a mountain near Makkah.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ
translation: Surely We have created man in the best form[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., in upright and balanced form and nature.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ رَدَدۡنَٰهُ أَسۡفَلَ سَٰفِلِينَ
translation: then We will reduce him to the lowest of the low[5],
footnotes: [5] i.e., to the depths of Hell due to deviation from uprightness; or to decrepit old age.

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ
translation: except those who believe and do righteous deeds; they will have a never-ending reward.

arabic_text: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعۡدُ بِٱلدِّينِ
translation: Then, what makes you deny the Judgment Day?

arabic_text: أَلَيۡسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحۡكَمِ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ
translation: Is not Allah the Most Just of all judges?

arabic_text: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ
translation: Read in the name of your Lord Who created,

arabic_text: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ
translation: created man from a clinging clot.

arabic_text: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ
translation: Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِٱلۡقَلَمِ
translation: Who taught by the pen,

arabic_text: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مَا لَمۡ يَعۡلَمۡ
translation: taught man what he did not know[1].
footnotes: [1] These five verses (1-5) are the first ever verses revealed of the Qur’an. The Prophet (ﷺ) was retreating at a cave in the outskirts of Makkah when the angel Gabriel appeared before him, and ordered him to read. Since the Prophet (ﷺ) was unlettered, he would respond, “I cannot read.” Gabriel would then squeeze him tightly and order him again to read. Ultimately, Gabriel said to him: “Read in the name of your Lord …”.

arabic_text: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَيَطۡغَىٰٓ
translation: Indeed, man transgresses

arabic_text: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰٓ
translation: when he deems himself to be self-sufficient.

arabic_text: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجۡعَىٰٓ
translation: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

arabic_text: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يَنۡهَىٰ
translation: Have you seen the one who prevents[2]
footnotes: [2] i.e., Abu Jahl was a pagan leader of the Makkah who was an arch-enemy of Islam.

arabic_text: عَبۡدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ
translation: a slave [of Allah] from praying[3]?
footnotes: [3] Abu Jahl abused the Prophet (ﷺ) when he prayed in the Holy Mosque.

arabic_text: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ
translation: What if this [slave] is rightly guided,

arabic_text: أَوۡ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقۡوَىٰٓ
translation: and enjoins righteousness?

arabic_text: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ
translation: How about the one who denies and turns away[4]?
footnotes: [4] From what the Prophet (ﷺ) has brought and does he not fear Allah?

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَعۡلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
translation: Does he not know that Allah is watching all?

arabic_text: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
translation: No indeed; if he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[5]
footnotes: [5] To the Hellfire.

arabic_text: نَاصِيَةٖ كَٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٖ
translation: a lying, sinful forelock[6].
footnotes: [6] It alludes to the frontal lobe of the brain, where reasoning is processed.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَدۡعُ نَادِيَهُۥ
translation: So let him call his associates;

arabic_text: سَنَدۡعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ
translation: We will call the wardens of Hellfire[7].
footnotes: [7] i.e., the coarse, rigorous, and harsh angels assigned for the Hellfire.

arabic_text: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعۡهُ وَٱسۡجُدۡۤ وَٱقۡتَرِب۩
translation: No indeed; do not obey him, but prostrate and draw near [to Allah].

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ فِي لَيۡلَةِ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ
translation: Indeed, We sent this [Qur’an] down on the Night of Decree[1].
footnotes: [1] The Qur’an was first revealed completely to the lowest heaven on this night. Also, its revelation on the Prophet (ﷺ) started on this night.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ
translation: How do you know what the Night of Decree is?

arabic_text: لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أَلۡفِ شَهۡرٖ
translation: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

arabic_text: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذۡنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمۡرٖ
translation: On that night the angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend by their Lord’s permission with all decrees[2].
footnotes: [2] Bringing down the exact provisions, life, death, and other things destined for the creatures for the coming year by Allah's permission.

arabic_text: سَلَٰمٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطۡلَعِ ٱلۡفَجۡرِ
translation: It is all peace[3] until the break of dawn.
footnotes: [3] Upon the believers.

arabic_text: لَمۡ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأۡتِيَهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
translation: Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book and the polytheists were not going to desist [from disbelief][1] until there came to them clear proof,
footnotes: [1] i.e., and from deviant ways.

arabic_text: رَسُولٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتۡلُواْ صُحُفٗا مُّطَهَّرَةٗ
translation: a messenger from Allah, reciting pure pages[2]
footnotes: [2] i.e., that contains no falsehood.

arabic_text: فِيهَا كُتُبٞ قَيِّمَةٞ
translation: containing upright commandments.

arabic_text: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
translation: Yet those who were given the Scripture did not disagree[3] except after the clear proof came to them,
footnotes: [3] Into different sects and denominations.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓاْ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤۡتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلۡقَيِّمَةِ
translation: although they were commanded only to worship Allah with sincere devotion to Him, being inclined to the true faith, and to establish prayer and give zakah; that is the true religion.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ شَرُّ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ
translation: Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding therein forever. It is they who are the worst of creatures.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ
translation: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds – it is they who are the best of creatures.

arabic_text: جَزَآؤُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتُ عَدۡنٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۖ رَّضِيَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُواْ عَنۡهُۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنۡ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُۥ
translation: Their reward with their Lord is Gardens of Eternity under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. This is for those who fear their Lord.

arabic_text: إِذَا زُلۡزِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زِلۡزَالَهَا
translation: When the earth is shaken with a mighty quake,

arabic_text: وَأَخۡرَجَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَثۡقَالَهَا
translation: and the earth throws out its burdens[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., its dead bodies and treasures.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا لَهَا
translation: and man says[2], “What is the matter with it?”
footnotes: [2] In terror and astonishment.

arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُحَدِّثُ أَخۡبَارَهَا
translation: On that Day it will recount all its news,

arabic_text: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوۡحَىٰ لَهَا
translation: because your Lord has inspired it [to do so].

arabic_text: يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَصۡدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشۡتَاتٗا لِّيُرَوۡاْ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ
translation: On that Day all people will come forward in separate groups to be shown their deeds[3].
footnotes:
[3] From the place of Judgment to see the consequences of their deeds, whether to Paradise or to Hell.
 [MMCXIII]

arabic_text: فَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيۡرٗا يَرَهُۥ
translation: So whoever does an atom’s weight[4] of good will see it,
footnotes: [4] Or a small ant’s weight.

arabic_text: وَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٖ شَرّٗا يَرَهُۥ
translation: and whoever does an atom’s weight of evil will see it.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡعَٰدِيَٰتِ ضَبۡحٗا
translation: By the galloping, panting horses[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., those horses that fight for the cause of Allah as they race to attack the enemy.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُورِيَٰتِ قَدۡحٗا
translation: striking sparks of fire [with their hooves][2],
footnotes: [2] While galloping over rocky terrain.

arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبۡحٗا
translation: launching raids at dawn[3],
footnotes: [3] While the enemy is unaware of their raid.

arabic_text: فَأَثَرۡنَ بِهِۦ نَقۡعٗا
translation: stirring up thereby clouds of dust,

arabic_text: فَوَسَطۡنَ بِهِۦ جَمۡعًا
translation: plunging thereby into the midst of the enemy[4],
footnotes: [4] i.e., penetrating into the ranks of the enemy as a surprise attack.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٞ
translation: indeed, man is very ungrateful to his Lord[5] –
footnotes: [5] disobeying Him by not spending in the cause of Allah from what He has given him and commanded him to spend accordingly.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٞ
translation: and he himself is a witness to that[6] –
footnotes: [6] By his words and actions.

arabic_text: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
translation: and he is truly extreme in his love of wealth.

arabic_text: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ
translation: Does he not know that when the contents of graves will be overturned,

arabic_text: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي ٱلصُّدُورِ
translation: and the secrets of the hearts will be brought to light[7]?
footnotes: [7] i.e., when all secrets of the hearts and faiths are made known.

arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّخَبِيرُۢ
translation: Indeed, their Lord is All-Aware of them on that Day[8].
footnotes: [8] Nothing of their affairs will be hidden from Him.

arabic_text: ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ
translation: The Striking Calamity!

arabic_text: مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ
translation: What is the Striking Calamity?

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ
translation: How do you know what the Striking Calamity is?

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلۡفَرَاشِ ٱلۡمَبۡثُوثِ
translation: On that Day people will be like scattered moths[1],
footnotes: [1] After having been thrown out of their graves.

arabic_text: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ٱلۡمَنفُوشِ
translation: and the mountains will be like carded wool[2].
footnotes: [2] As they disintegrate.

arabic_text: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
translation: Then the one whose scales of good deeds are heavy,

arabic_text: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ
translation: will have a pleasant life[3].
footnotes: [3] In Paradise.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ
translation: But the one whose scales of good deeds are light,

arabic_text: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٞ
translation: his abode will be the abyss[4].
footnotes: [4] Hāwiyah: the pit of Hellfire.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهۡ
translation: And how do you know what it is?

arabic_text: نَارٌ حَامِيَةُۢ
translation: It is a Blazing Fire.

arabic_text: أَلۡهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ
translation: Competition for worldly gains distracts you [from Allah],

arabic_text: حَتَّىٰ زُرۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَقَابِرَ
translation: until you come to your graves.

arabic_text: كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: No indeed! You will come to know.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ
translation: Again no! You will come to know.

arabic_text: كَلَّا لَوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عِلۡمَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
translation: No indeed! If only you knew for certain[1].
footnotes: [1] The conclusion of this verse, "...you would not have been distracted from preparing for the Hereafter by wealth and children."

arabic_text: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ
translation: You will surely see the Blazing Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيۡنَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
translation: Again, you will see it with absolute certainty.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ لَتُسۡـَٔلُنَّ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
translation: Then on that Day you will surely be asked about your worldly pleasures[2].
footnotes: [2] i.e., of health and wealth and other comforts of the worldly life.

arabic_text: وَٱلۡعَصۡرِ
translation: By the time,

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَفِي خُسۡرٍ
translation: man is in utter loss,

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ
translation: except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and exhort one another to the truth and exhort one another to patience.

arabic_text: وَيۡلٞ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٖ لُّمَزَةٍ
translation: Woe to every backbiter and slanderer,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالٗا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ
translation: who amasses wealth and counts it over and again[1],
footnotes: [1] Instead of spending in the way of Allah.

arabic_text: يَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخۡلَدَهُۥ
translation: thinking that his wealth will make him live forever.

arabic_text: كَلَّاۖ لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِي ٱلۡحُطَمَةِ
translation: No indeed! He will surely be cast into the Crushing Fire[2],
footnotes: [2] i.e., Hellfire, as it crushes and destroys all that is thrown in it.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحُطَمَةُ
translation: and how do you know what the Crushing Fire is?

arabic_text: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُوقَدَةُ
translation: It is the kindled Fire of Allah,

arabic_text: ٱلَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةِ
translation: which reaches the hearts[3].
footnotes: [3] Penetrating through bodies and reaching the hearts.

arabic_text: إِنَّهَا عَلَيۡهِم مُّؤۡصَدَةٞ
translation: It will be closed down upon them,

arabic_text: فِي عَمَدٖ مُّمَدَّدَةِۭ
translation: locked with towering columns[4].
footnotes: [4] i.e., columns of fire or columns of iron to which the inmates of Hell are chained.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡفِيلِ
translation: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the Elephant[1]?
footnotes: [1] The army of Abrahah al-Ashram was accompanied by a huge elephant who came with the intention of demolishing the Kaʿba.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَجۡعَلۡ كَيۡدَهُمۡ فِي تَضۡلِيلٖ
translation: Did He not turn their scheme into a total loss[2]?
footnotes: [2] Leading them to perish.

arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ طَيۡرًا أَبَابِيلَ
translation: He sent against them swarms of birds,

arabic_text: تَرۡمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٖ مِّن سِجِّيلٖ
translation: pelting them with stones of baked clay,

arabic_text: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ كَعَصۡفٖ مَّأۡكُولِۭ
translation: leaving them like chewed-up chaff.

arabic_text: لِإِيلَٰفِ قُرَيۡشٍ
translation: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1],
footnotes: [1] Allah had given Quraysh the honor of being guardians of the Holy Ka‘bah, which allowed them to travel in peace without fear of being harmed.

arabic_text: إِۦلَٰفِهِمۡ رِحۡلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيۡفِ
translation: secure in their winter and summer journeys[2].
footnotes: [2] i.e., their trading caravans would travel south to Yemen in winter and north to the Levant in summer.

arabic_text: فَلۡيَعۡبُدُواْ رَبَّ هَٰذَا ٱلۡبَيۡتِ
translation: Let them worship the Lord of this [Sacred] House[3],
footnotes: [3] i.e., the Ka‘bah.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ
translation: Who fed them against hunger and made them secure against fear[4].
footnotes: [4] The people of Quraysh were blessed with provision and security probably because of the prayer of Abraham. See 14:35-37

arabic_text: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ
translation: Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?

arabic_text: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِي يَدُعُّ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ
translation: Such is the one who repulses the orphan harshly,

arabic_text: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ
translation: and does not urge others to feed the needy.

arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُصَلِّينَ
translation: So woe to those who pray,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَن صَلَاتِهِمۡ سَاهُونَ
translation: but are heedless of their prayer[1];
footnotes: [1] i.e., the hypocrites who do not pray except to show off and others who are heedless to pray at their specified times.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ يُرَآءُونَ
translation: those who only show off,

arabic_text: وَيَمۡنَعُونَ ٱلۡمَاعُونَ
translation: and withhold even the small kindnesses.

arabic_text: إِنَّآ أَعۡطَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡكَوۡثَرَ
translation: We have surely given you [O Prophet] al-Kauthar [i.e., abundance][1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., abundance, of which is the river of al-Kauthar in Paradise.

arabic_text: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنۡحَرۡ
translation: so pray and offer sacrifice to your Lord alone.

arabic_text: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلۡأَبۡتَرُ
translation: Indeed, the one who hates you is truly cut off [from all goodness][2].
footnotes: [2] Both in this world and in the Hereafter.

arabic_text: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ
translation: Say, “O disbelievers,

arabic_text: لَآ أَعۡبُدُ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
translation: I do not worship what you worship,

arabic_text: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ
translation: nor do you worship what I worship.

arabic_text: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٞ مَّا عَبَدتُّمۡ
translation: Never will I worship what you worship,

arabic_text: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ
translation: nor will you ever worship what I worship.

arabic_text: لَكُمۡ دِينُكُمۡ وَلِيَ دِينِ
translation: You have your religion and I have my religion."

arabic_text: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ
translation: When there comes Allah’s help and the conquest[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the conquest of Makkah.

arabic_text: وَرَأَيۡتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدۡخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفۡوَاجٗا
translation: and you see people entering Allah’s religion in multitudes,

arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرۡهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابَۢا
translation: then glorify the praise of your Lord, and ask His forgiveness. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.

arabic_text: تَبَّتۡ يَدَآ أَبِي لَهَبٖ وَتَبَّ
translation: May the hands of Abu Lahab[1] perish, and may he perish!
footnotes: [1] i.e., the Prophet's uncle, who was one of the staunchest enemies of Islam.

arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ
translation: Neither his wealth nor his worldly gains will avail him.

arabic_text: سَيَصۡلَىٰ نَارٗا ذَاتَ لَهَبٖ
translation: He will burn in a Flaming Fire,

arabic_text: وَٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلۡحَطَبِ
translation: and so will his wife[2], the carrier of firewood,
footnotes: [2] i.e., ’Um Jamīl, who used to throw thorny branches in the Prophet's way and she used to slander him (ﷺ). The word hatab (firewood) was used by the Arabs to allude to slander and backbiting.

arabic_text: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبۡلٞ مِّن مَّسَدِۭ
translation: around her neck will be a rope of palm fiber[3].
footnotes: [3] This surah was one of the earliest surahs revealed in Makkah, yet Abu Lahab persisted in disbelief. For him to disprove the Qur’an, all he had to do was to accept Islam, for the Qur’an condemned him to Hell.

arabic_text: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
translation: Say: “He is Allah, the One[1];
footnotes: [1] He is Alone, without a partner, indivisible and distinct from all else. The only true deity, unique in His essence, attributes, and actions.

arabic_text: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ
translation: Allah, the Eternal Refuge[2].
footnotes: [2] He is absolute, perfect, complete, self-sufficient; the one eternally and constantly required and sought; all existence depend upon Him; all matters ultimately return to Him.

arabic_text: لَمۡ يَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ يُولَدۡ
translation: He neither begets nor is He begotten,

arabic_text: وَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدُۢ
translation: and there is none comparable to Him.”[3]
footnotes: [3] The Prophet (ﷺ) says that reading this surah (surat al-Ikhlās) equals reading one third of the Qur’an. [Al-Bukhāri and Muslim]

arabic_text: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ
translation: Say, “I seek refuge with the Lord of the daybreak,

arabic_text: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
translation: from the harm of all what He has created;

arabic_text: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
translation: from the harm of darkening [night] when it spreads around,

arabic_text: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِي ٱلۡعُقَدِ
translation: from the harm of the sorceresses[1] who blow on knots,
footnotes: [1] i.e., magicians.

arabic_text: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
translation: and from the harm of the envier when he envies."

arabic_text: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ
translation: Say, “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind,

arabic_text: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ
translation: the Sovereign of mankind[1],
footnotes: [1] i.e., the King of mankind.

arabic_text: إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ
translation: the God of mankind,

arabic_text: مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ
translation: from the harm of the lurking whisperer[2],
footnotes: [2] Which disappears when one remembers Allah.

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِي يُوَسۡوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ
translation: who whispers into the hearts of mankind,

arabic_text: مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ
translation: from among jinn and mankind[3].”
footnotes: [3] Evil prompters and whisperers can be from jinn or from men.
